"The Rolling Waves" (Stops table) by Amelia Gorman – Countless tracks branch out from the City by the Sea like so many tentacles. Some routes cling tight to the coastline, where stops are shaped by the waves and tides. Pause to explore cities carved from dead leviathans, Sinkhole Village, or the Scented Lighthouse cooking messages on its signal fire.
"Snakes on a Train" (Events table) by Ashley Flanagan – In a world where massive engines haul thrill seekers across a deadly wasteland, danger is a way of life. Violence and speed make every moment a potential climax. Introspection and doubt are well and good, but sometimes a train is just rigged to explode – or a deadly cargo stalks the passengers – or an elite group of aristocrats monopolizes the train’s resources. Lock and load.
$17 000 CAD (reached!)
Expanded character folio by Francita Soto – Keep a record of your journey in style: the very talented Francita Soto will redesign the Cerebos character sheet into a print-and-play passport style character folio. Check out her porfolio to see some of her past RPG character sheet designs.
$19 000 CAD (reached!)
"Coins for Kitsch" (Stops table) by Kevin Snow – Any well-traveled route presents economic opportunities for storytellers in rural towns and communities left behind. Experience guided tours of regionally famous murders, supposedly sacred monuments, and oversized sculptures of obscure cryptids. Are their histories true or invented? Whatever you believe, be sure to grab a postcard.
"Onboard Amenities" (Events table) by Paul "Ettin" Matijevic – The train is more than just a box to move travelers between strange lands. It’s an environment in its own right, home to a collection of cars that unlock on their own timetables. The Conductor may have more information about the game hall where familiar diversions are stocked with forbidden pieces. But the dining car that serves up meals from travelers’ pasts? It is a mystery!
$22 000 CAD (reached!)
Random Touchstones table by Zach Welhouse – The Cerebos core rulebook will be expanded with a d666 table of random Touchstones to help inspire your traveler's mysterious past and portentous future. This colossal table will span six full pages and include 216 entries, ranging from the prosaic, to the preposterous, to the simply perplexing. What burdens will your traveler carry?
$24 000 CAD (reached!)
"Once-Sacred Spaces" (Stops table) by Natalie Ash – Still serene and tranquil, time and abandonment have obscured their sacred purposes. Who once worshipped in these halls, and to what gods or forces? what traces can be found and what stories can be gleaned?
"Performance (An Act in Six Parts)" (Events table) by Madeleine Ember – Rejoice! An esteemed circus troupe is en route to Cerebos, and they’ve made themselves at home. Marvel at the woman made of ribbon and her scintillating dance of wonder! Behold the cunning mouse circus and learn the secrets of your very own rafters! Meet a lion, a juggler, a shadow, and more!
$27 000 CAD (reached!)
Introductory comic by Cynthia Yuan Cheng. Cerebos artist Cynthia Yuan Cheng will produce a comic to help introduce the game's themes and set the tone for your journey across the endless desert. The comic will be included in the core rulebook and offered as free download via the Penguin King Games website. You've seen Cynthia's work in the preview material and on this very Kickstarter page, and she's an experienced comic artist as well – we'll be excited to have her bring the world of Cerebos to life.
Zach Welhouse is a librarian and game designer based out of the Pacific Northwest. His past writing credits include contributions to Costume Fairy Adventures, Deadlands, and Hard Wired Island. He enjoys hot drinks, taking the scenic route, and dogs who look like goblins. Find him on DriveThruRPG, Twitter, and reviewing video games for RPGamer.
Francita Soto is a graphic designer from Chile who works for companies and individuals in the TTRPG community as a freelancer. She loves doing character sheets and logos, and she is currently taking commissions! Check byfrancita.com for details.
Shel Kahn loves RPGs! They illustrate and write for tabletop RPGs, run them for schools and museums, and organize RPG sessions and game jams with DMG. Kahn’s self-published adventures include Keep on the Shining Isle, The Corruption of Pelursk, and most recently, The Ghost Houses of Phylinecra. In their spare time, Kahn also creates original comics and art. Learn more at portablecity.net.
Cynthia Yuan Cheng is an illustrator and comics artist based in sunny Los Angeles. She enjoys creating warm, hopeful narratives exploring relationships, identity, and personal experience. Find more of her artwork at cynthiaycheng.com.
Penguin King Games is an established purveyor of fine tabletop diversions, ranging from weighty tomes about the power of fashion to one-page oneshots about anarchist catgirls. Cerebos will be Penguin King Games' second crowdfunded publication, after 2013's Costume Fairy Adventures. Find us at penguinking.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In our last Kickstarter campaign, we offered a complex multi-tiered reward structure with items being produced all over the world, and what we learned from that experience is "don't do that". This time around, we're keeping it straightforward: simple rewards, simple add-ons, and stretch goals that just add more of what we're already doing. We've also taken several steps to ensure that nobody is left hanging:

First, we're not trying to sell you the *idea* of a game. "Cerebos: The Crystal City" is already written, playtested, edited, illustrated, and has been given a first-pass layout, and that version of the game will be in your hands in digital form immediately after the campaign ends. If the project funds and the following week we all get run over by a train, you'll still have a playable (and very pretty!) game in hand.

Second, we've ensured that all physical rewards can be printed under one roof, and we've kept things local – as in within-driving-distance-of-our-office local – rather than going overseas for cheaper options. That means we've been obliged to make our physical rewards a little pricier than they've been in the past, but it also means that we have a level of accountability that wouldn't be possible otherwise. 

Finally, as always, Penguin King Games has a no-questions-asked refund policy for late projects. If we're even one day past our target delivery date, and you don't have 100% of your promised rewards in hand, you can ask for a refund and you'll get it within 24 hours. We'd be sorry to lose your support, but, well, that just gives us an incentive to keep things on track!

campaign.story:
Dip into The Well!
The Well is a roleplaying zine with a complete, rules-light narrative-focused game and the ingredients for a long form story campaign. 
We set out to create a ruleset with a few key ingredients - we wanted something:
Tactile, with pieces players can hold instead of dice
Minimalist, with rules that get out of the way
Prep-friendly for GMs who like thinking ahead and being surprised at the table
The system we created supported a year long campaign through the ages of myth and we can't wait to see what you do with it!
Filling the Well
Each game will be driven by  unique Story Tokens that the GM and players contribute to a shared pool, mixed in the larger pool of tokens that represent a balance of power in the world. The GM takes some time between sessions to link ideas and inspiration to each of the unique Story Tokens. During play the GM can see when players have these tokens in hand and quickly review their notes, so that when the Story Token is played they can weave in the connected ideas. That one play might trigger a subtle ongoing effect, a surprising twist, or a world-changing event!
Every session the makeup of The Well evolves - Tokens played and avoided are matched into the pool and the GM can add more Story Tokens based on their ongoing prep. 
The Well in play
The Zine
The rules are complete and tested, and we are adding more examples of play as we head into layout. And while The Well looks great as a big bowl brimming with glass beads and trinkets, we can't quite pack all that in an envelope - the Zinequest edition will include a tear-out sheet with tokens and note sheets to plan your sessions. We have firmed up the layout at 24 pages, including a heavier cover and an example setup. The tokens will be an extra cardstock sheet included, tucked inside, so you don't need to chop up the zine to play the quickstart.
I will be handling the printing locally and mailing personally to avoid delays & logistics issues and to roll my sleeves up making a zine. The PDF will be same content as the printed zine, in printer-friendly layout for duplication at home. If we expand content (i.e. with additional prewritten setups) beyond what can be mailed at the planned rates, we will making it available in the PDF.
Rewards
Keeping it simple! Every pledge includes a PDF of the Zine, with delivery via Itch.io .
Pledges at the Physical (Hold it in your hands / Heaping Handful) levels include one PDF code for each physical copy, and the Heaping Handful level lets you team up with friends to soften the shipping. For physical I will be able to ship in standard document envelopes and avoid most of the nightmares of international borders.
Funded! Onward and upward: Stretch Goals
$666 - At this auspicious goal, printed versions will also get an unrelated but fun (dis)loyalty card to use with their Mork Borg* campaigns as a tracker for Miseries. These business card sized trackers will be laminated for reuse, if one apocalypse isn't enough! 
Mork Borg Bonus Mockup
$1000 - I will double up the pre-written setups, adding a second sheet of Story Tokens and connected prompts. These will be included for both print and PDF.
Again, simplicity is key here and I want to focus on the promised content of the zine!

Notes: After development and launch I was notified of another project with the same "The Well" title. I'm glad our campaigns didn't overlap! So for clarity - the two projects are entirely unrelated, but you should also check out their game about delving and plunder.
* Nechrubucks/Eskalating Eskatons is an independent production by Shawn McCarthy and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License. MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.

updates.update_content:
No jokes here, just news!
A month and a half ago I was a ball of nerves with my mouse hovering over [LAUNCH].  Would this oddball game for people who crave those "we didn't even touch the dice!" sessions pique anyone?
Today I'm looking at a case of printed zines, all tucked in clear slips, waiting for one last pack of cardstock. 90+% of the surveys are back, and as soon as KS clears the funds (poor timing for a long weekend, I must say!) I'll filter the address list and hit the post office to find out just how much I inevitably misjudged weights and postage.

Since my hands will be full in 14 hours when the campaign ends, I wanted to get this out to everyone (all 100-or-so of you, including retailers) who is supporting at various levels. It looks like I will be ordering a top-up for the printed material, and then the envelope prep begins, and the address confirmation surveys go out, even while the financial wizards figure out whose payments work on the first try and who needs to update their cards. It’s also the right time to tune your pledge - if you were on the fence about a print copy, or if you need to shift some money to the grocery account - do what you’ve got to do. If you had to sit this out because of hardship, stay tuned and I will be posting a link to pick up digital (or surplus print) copies in the future, once rewards are mailed.

Happy Monday! The main file is ready to send to the print shop. Thanks to your support I won’t need to wait for KS to clear the payments before I start the print run, I’m just waiting on the final backer count so I don’t under-order copies. The mailing supplies assembly line is ready too.
I’m keeping a close eye on the total - it looks like we’re very close to the first stretch goal so I’m getting that ready for print too. And ever the optimist, I’ve got my notes ready for extra setting & token quick starts for the $1000 goal.

Text is done, layout is blocked, illustrations are coming along, test printing for weight and readability looks great. I’ll be playing online this week with Tony “Plus One EXP” Vasinda, and will share a link to that later!

Hi again! The writing is complete, the first layout cut is complete. I'll be transferring to a hardcopy for marking up with notes, turning some photos into inked illustrations, and then bringing that back into the digital files. 
In the meantime, I used the smooth timeline to work on a side project for Mork Bork - a rules hack for the apocalyptic calendar that hangs over the game. One part of that was a silly "coffee club" style loyalty card tracker that got some great feedback. So I'm taking the opportunity to tuck it into this project as a fun Stretch Goal.

Funded, thanks to you
Hello and welcome back, and thanks again! 
Carrying Water
After a refreshing weekend with a chance to game with friends, I'm back to the grind. First, I'm going through the text and touching up wording throughout based on some test reads. Nothing mechanical is changing, though, but I'm expanding some explanations and reigning in some wandering paragraphs which will leave more room for good stuff.

As I sign off for the day we’re one pledge shy of funding. I’ve spent the evening working on illustrations for the booklet and doing my best to avoid peeking here every two minutes.
A big thanks to you. And you. And you, too!

campaign.story:
Return to the world of Root with The Marauder Expansion. Raze the Woodland to the ground as the fearsome Lord of the Hundreds, or recover precious relics from this destructive conflict as the Keepers in Iron. Explore dozens of faction combinations, including many new head-to-head matchups with the hirelings and advanced setup cards. New and experienced players have never had so many ways to enjoy Root!
The Keepers in Iron are an order of itinerant warriors who have come to the Woodland to recover ancient relics. To find them, they must manage their Woodland contacts carefully, as only the local animals know how to find the relics they seek. Paragons of discipline, their warriors sport pristine armor of a quality rarely seen here, making them a terror in battle. However, to keep their forces well-supplied and mobile, they must maintain a network of caravans and waystations.
Claiming to be the true voice of the Woodland, the Lord of the Hundreds spreads distrust and division among its inhabitants, inciting torch-wielding mobs to destroy the enemies of their righteous dominion. His swarming army can overwhelm all but the toughest defense. By looting items from the undeserving and adding them to his towering hoard, his power grows as he develops an increasingly fearsome monomania.
Root's hirelings lend their services to factions willing to pay the price. Court the Marquise's infamous Forest Patrol or sway the rampaging Last Dynasty from the Eyrie to join your cause. Whether you are playing with two players or six, the hirelings are sure to offer you exciting new ways to play Root. 
Discover new corners of the world of Root.  Fight for control of the cosmopolitan Free City of Root or attempt to secure influence over the Black Market. Build buildings among the Elder Treetops or secure the Legendary Forge. Each landmark offers players new strategic challenges and tactical possibilities. Best of all, they work with each of Root's four maps!
With your support in 2019, the Underworld Kickstarter brought Root to more players than ever before. In the years since the game’s release, Root continues to enjoy a vibrant and welcoming community of old and new players alike.
At Leder Games, we are deeply grateful for this community. Because of you all, we can keep food on our tables and the lights on at the office. You also give us space to take risks and develop new games. And, perhaps best of all, your support means that we can continue exploring the world of Root!
Root: The Marauder Expansion is the next chapter in the series. The expansion offers two new factions: the Lord of the Hundreds and the Keepers in Iron. Both factions are designed to work seamlessly with all previous factions and provide players with unique gameplay challenges and the dramatic, narrative-first asymmetry that has become a hallmark of Root’s design.
The expansion also introduces the hireling system. This is a gameplay option that can be used at any player count and faction mix. Hirelings are perfect for folks wanting the experience of Root as a two-player contest or who want to inject their multiplayer games with even more combos and color from the game’s wider world.
Root is a fully asymmetric strategy board game designed by Cole Wehrle, lavishly illustrated by Kyle Ferrin, and brought to life by the team at Leder Games. Stalk the woods as one of the Vagabonds, seize the initiative with the Eyrie birds of prey, rule over your subjects as the Marquise de Cat, or command the Woodland Alliance to create a new order. In Root, the players drive the narrative, and the differences among the roles create unparalleled interaction and replayability.    
To understand how Root integrates with all of our products in this campaign, as well as our current existing expansions, please refer to our New to Root Chart.
Root is currently in-stock and available on our webstore for most regions. (For North American backers, we have a pre-order open for late Spring delivery.) If you want to obtain a copy as fast as possible, check with your Friendly Local Game Store or consider ordering from our site. For other expansions and products, you can order directly from our webstore or visit your neighborhood game seller. We will not offer an “All-In” pledge, or include previous releases as add-ons for this campaign. 
At Leder Games, we are committed to sharing our design process openly. As with campaigns in the past, we'll be releasing preview kits both as print-and-play files and mods for Tabletop Simulator. The first kit will be released on Thursday the 25th, and the second will arrive on the week following. 
Click here to download the preview kit!

If you are looking for players, you can find a huge community over on Leder Games' official Discord channel, the Woodland Warriors. 
Shipping will be charged post-campaign in Backerkit.

Customs and Duty-Free Shipping
Leder Games will pre-pay the duties and taxes for the backers who receive their games in the US, EU, Canada, and Australia. All other countries or regions may be subject to additional customs fees upon delivery.

For our UK friends: At this time the UK has not provided a mechanism that will allow this type of pre-payment for crowdfunded projects fulfilling after June 2021. We are working with our VAT agency to find a solution, but at this time there is not one available. It is likely that by the time we’re making plans for fulfillment there will not be additional VAT, but we cannot promise this with the ongoing legislation changes. We are keeping a close eye on developments, and will provide updates as we are able during the campaign and leading up to fulfillment. We assure you we wish Brexit had less effect, but alas here we are.
Countries we cannot ship to: Afghanistan, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan,  and Syria.

campaign.story:
First thing and apology.
I couldn't get this RPG Zine printed, as sadly I don't have a printer. But I've formatted a special version of the PDF that should allow anyone who wishes to print off their very own copy to go in their collection. 
Please take time to check out all the other amazing RPGs on Kickstarter during Zine Quest, they all look amazing!

Now down to business. Here is my story:
Lockdown has been tough on everyone, and people have tried to find different ways to fill their time whilst stuck in their homes. This is what led me to designing and writing Captain's Log.
I was inspired by the classic opening moments of every episode of Star Trek TNG, and those immortal words..
"Captain's Log.."
That always let you know, you were in for an out of this world adventure, and I wanted to simulate the fun and excitement of those missions.

Captain’s Log is a solo journaling RPG where you find yourself in the command of a ship, its crew embarking on a vast mission through space. 
The limits to this mission are defined by your imagination, and the stories you bring to life.
Playing the Captain's Log is simple and offers hours of creative storytelling fun.

Captain's log has two modes:
Campaign
A 50 entry mission journalling adventure where you will be given the scenario outline of each log entry. Each of these entries will journel a mission, a day and event of note onboard your very own ship.
From there it's up to you to decide where the story goes and what twists and turns await the ship and its crew.

Scenario Generation
These are one off scenarios that can just be generated by simply using a 6 sided dice, or failing that the random number sheet located at  the end of this RPG.
This system will see you generate a unique combination that becomes your scenario.
The system will give you:
A location
A Plot Event
A Subplot
Then as with the campaign the rest is up to you. 
These can be played in single stand alone missions, or perhaps you want to chain them together and make another campaign to take your crew on.
 
This project is for anyone who enjoys creative writing.
Or perhaps someone with a simple love of SCI-FI, who doesn’t know just how creative they can be.
The results of your ‘Captain’s Log’ can be as public or as private, as long or as short as you decide. Writing each entry should be a way to challenge yourself into being creative. You might expand characters and plots over the full campaign, or might just take it one scenario at a time and see where you take your adventure.

This RPG can be played however you want, and I encourage you to be creative. 
But every new scenario dictates an adventure, a fresh scenario for you to bring to life.
Then with each entry you make the world around you and your characters will grow, becoming ever more vivid as you journal the history of your ship, and it’s colourful crew.
To start the campaign:
You pick your crew
You design your ship
You create new alien races
You create a nemesis, and give them a back story
You decide your ships mission
Perhaps you'll borrow ideas from mainstream SCI-FI? Or Mix multiple films and shows together to create a new larger expanded universe?

You'll decide how your adventure unfolds.
You are the Captain, and this is the Captain’s Log.


My name is Matt and I live in Leeds, and I own and play more tabletop games than I should admit. You can find me on Instagram  HERE 
I'll be honest I was undecided as to if I would ever complete this RPG, let alone share it with others. From my initial idea for the RPG I've been plagued with self doubt about how this would be received, and visions of having to refund the small amount of people who actually backed it.
But this isn't about failure, this is about creating something I'm proud of and sending it out into the world for the purpose of saying I did. Like this RPG it's about being creative to challenge yourself. So now I can turn round and say I created something. So if it turns out only 1 person plays this campaign after the Kickstarter is over, that for me is still a success.

I wish everyone good health, and a positive future in this dark time.
And a big THANK YOU for everyone who took time to look at this project.
And another even bigger THANK YOU to anyone who backed it.
I hope you enjoy it as much as I did designing it.
THANK YOU

by Christophe Laudamiel and Carmen Antreasian
You know his scents, you know his success, now you're invited behind the scenes!  
His entire career, Christophe has been exposing the art of perfumery. Now in his first photo book, Christophe discloses all, literally and visually: revealing his convictions, his travels, his perfume expertise and even himself for a good cause.  


5 CHAPTERS 
 FORAGING THE WORLD: photos documenting Christophe's travels over several years foraging the world for exotic ingredients and olfactory inspirations
 SPECIAL EFFECTS: photos illustrating special effects used by perfumers
 DONATING HIS BODY FOR AWARENESS AND TRANSPARENCY: a photo campaign to raise credibility and debunk secrecy about the sense of smell and the art of perfumery
 #TIMESUPFORBSINPERFUMERY: straightening up some facts and injecting some ethics
 THE BEST NOSE IN THE LAB: Christophe's beloved dog, Yuki, teaches us some wisdom
Important notes on PERFUMERY REVEALED 
This publication is rated PG-13 and includes a few nude photos of Christophe exhibited in New York City art galleries. One of the book chapters is about raising awareness and promoting transparency.
In order to respect the photos and scents inside, the book will NOT be available online. Suggested retail price in the USA: $82.00 excluding taxes.
This book shares Christophe's knowledge and passion and shall help Perfumery by educating a larger audience, while bringing some casual and good fun along the way. The seasoned connoisseurs are in for some good surprises too!

campaign.story:
STORIED Volume One
ABOUT US
STORIED /ˈstɔːrɪd/ adjective
celebrated or associated with stories or legends.

As an independent magazine-cum-journal and online platform, STORIED celebrates the notion of slow and sustainable journalism, touching personal narratives and considered recommendations for the conscientious explorer. We're launching our print journey on Kickstarter because of the sense of community this platform encourages. It also means that we can pay our contributors and printers up front and gauge print numbers, only printing the number that we need to ensure we're as sustainable as possible.
The Kyoto Issue, 'ShinPuhKan' Mock Up
Hand-crafted Umbrella from Tokushima by Rachel E T Davies. Archival Print No. 5
It’s no secret that Japan has been high on the destination hit-list of many travellers and travel magazines for a number of years. Japan has seen a boom in tourism numbers of the past decade, subsequently causing more problems than benefits in certain areas. Our focus at STORIED is on creating sustainable change - actively combatting the country’s over-tourism by illuminating unique and boutique options and sharing with you, our readers, lesser-known areas of Japan. We think that this not only offers you truly exciting recommendations for travel, but also helps to foster a circular economy within local communities that want and need it. 
We’re reimagining the role of English language Japan-related content, moving away from stereotypical guides, to bring you a new take on what travel to Japan can be - intimate narratives from people who know Japan, delving deeply and broadly to bring tales of daily life and historic legacies, modern culture, and natural beauty. 
So, whether your interest is travel, design or cultural heritage, let the pages of STORIED take you on a journey into the true heart of Japan.

Indigo Skies in Kamishichiken by Rachel E T Davies. Archival Print No. 6
An Image from 'The Body, A Canvas' by Joe Keating. Archival Print No. 2

FOUNDERS BIO
RACHEL E T DAVIES & HANA TSUKAMOTO
I’m a British freelance journalist, photographer, and the founder of STORIED, based in Kyoto. I moved to Japan in January 2016 where I was instantly enthralled by the country where I began telling tales of Japan’s storied culture; its people, places, and hideaways, both for international magazines like CN Traveler, Suitcase, and Lodestars Anthology, and my own blog, Girljin in Japan.
It was in 2019 that I thought of collating my knowledge into a coffee-table style journal telling stories from Japan, but it was last year, during the pandemic, that allowed me the time to focus my attention on STORIED. After meeting Hana Tsukamoto, founder of POJ Studio and Maana Homes - a design-led, vacation-home brand - in Kyoto, we realised that we were a perfect fit to bring STORIED to life, harnessing our combined cultural, travel, and design backgrounds.
Together we have a huge love for, and experience in, editorial design, photography, story-telling, and considered living. We want to stimulate our reader’s interest in the incredible experiences that Japan has to offer, by way of a high-quality print publication whose focus is as much on design as it is on emotive and interesting content.
PLAY

PROJECT
This year has been strange to say the least. The State of Emergency in Japan gave us a chance to see the country in a way few of us would have before. We saw Kyoto devoid of tourists, tranquil, and beautiful. This got us thinking. Japan is a place that is often misunderstood, yet it is no longer the land of myth and mystery that it once was thought to be by outside travellers. The tourists, both domestic and foreign, which until last year arrived in droves, head to predetermined hotspots, all but ignoring the wider beauty of such a splendid archipelago. It seems like everyone is following the same itinerary, steered by media that churns out the same old content. And so it is with a conscientious heart and our own yearning to share truly new and intriguing insights into Japan, that we bring you our vision of what makes this country so spectacular.

The Kyoto Issue, 'The Tea Women of Wazuka' Mock Up

We collaborate with a talented team of creatives who call Japan home. Each issue brings you authentic content, engaging interviews, and intimate story-telling tailored to those amongst us who value the importance of investing in local communities. We want to both nurture new talent, and commission work from established creatives, so we’ll be joining forces with well-known contributors, whilst also giving young talent the opportunity to have their work seen and celebrated.
IyaGallery Orginal Watercolours by STORIED collaborator, Emilie Van Camp
For the launch of STORIED we were determined to include places rarely written about, rarely talked about, and rarely seen. Our first print issue takes us on a journey across Kyoto—a setting of significance as the cultural heart of Japan and the place that we at STORIED call home. Here are a few of our upcoming stories: 

Kyoto By the Sea by Rachel E T Davies
Contemporary Tea in Ancient City by Prairie Stuart-Wolff
Everyday Kyoto: Beauty in the Otherwise Mundane by Joe Keating
Beauty in Brevity by @Helvetica and Mitsuru Wakabayashi
The Body, A Canvas by Rachel E T Davies
Ototojet's Culinary Guide to Kyoto
The Journey to Self-Sufficiency by Vince Ng
Saving the City's Machiya by Rachel E T Davies

The Kyoto Issue, 'Everyday Kyoto' Mock Up
The Kyoto Issue, 'Considered Cloth' Mock Up

Why Kickstarter?
We’ve taken the decision to forgo advertising: this was a tough decision, but one which will allow us the freedom to make STORIED exactly as we want it. We know that people still love magazines and, although global print media sales have dwindled, independent magazines have seen a rise in figures. Why? Because people are longing for authentic publications like STORIED.
We want to launch STORIED’s print journey on Kickstarter because of the sense of community this platform encourages, and we know just how much of a team effort it takes to bring a magazine to life. Travel, too, is a collection of like-minded people coming together to enjoy a shared interest and learn new things from one another - something of the utmost importance to us at STORIED. 
Investing in STORIED as part of the Kickstarter campaign, rather than after we launch, means we can gauge print numbers and pay our contributors and printers up front. Following the initial campaign, subsequent issues will be released quarterly and become self-sustaining. STORIED will then be available direct from our website, as a direct-to-door subscription, as well as from select stores internationally.
Tranquil Temples by Rachel E T Davies. Archival Print No. 3

EDITORIAL CALENDAR
[ PRINT ]

 ISSUE 1: THE KYOTO ISSUE 
SPRING 2021 RELEASE

 ISSUE 2: THE ISLANDS ISSUE 
SUMMER 2021 RELEASE
Sharing the stories of Japan's many islands: small and large, remote and accessible. We journey to places that you have never heard of and explore a new side of places you have.

 ISSUE 3: THE CEDAR ISSUE 
AUTUMN 2021 RELEASE
Japan has a deep relationship with cedar - it built cities and now bathtubs, it burns as incense, the sweet smell being celebrated for thousands of years. In volume three we ruminate on the many facets of life that cedar is still in touch with today. 

 ISSUE 4: THE WATER ISSUE 
WINTER 2021 RELEASE
Snow, sea, sake. Water is connected to each and every one of these. In volume four, we embrace the power of water and explore the lives and ways of Japan's watery worlds.

REGULAR FEATURES
Seasonal Essay, Inspirational Women, Modern Culture Essay, Contemporary Art & Architecture, Design, Escape the City, STORIED Stays, Quiet Corners, Culinary Culture, Drinking & Dining

Ototojet's Sabazushi (pickled mackerel sushi). Archival Print No. 1

[ ONLINE ]

REGULAR FEATURES
Travel: Destinations, Insider Guides, Storied Stays
Craft & Design: Craftsmanship, Art & Design
Interviews: People
Drinking & Dining: Culinary Culture, Bars & Restaurants
Everyday Japan: Modern Culture
Mock Up STORIED online journal layout

At STORIED, we want to bring people together and spark conversation. We want to stimulate wanderlust and promote responsible travel, and we thank each of you amongst us who appreciates our mission to create authentic content.

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS
20cm x 24.5cm
~100 coloured pages
Printed with eco-friendly, soy-oil ink
Printed on eco-friendly, premium, 140gsm, matte paper. Made from recycled-pulp
Aim to go to print in March 2021 and shipped to all backers by April 2021

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We already have the content for STORIED ISSUE 1, and have paid the costs associated. The challenge left for us is to get an idea of pre-orders so that we can print enough copies to satiate the demand for STORIED, then we can turn our focus to making ISSUE 2 just as outstanding as our first.

There are no risks for us in completing STORIED Issue 1, however, within magazine printing and publishing there is always a small risk of a delay due to unexpected circumstances. Of course, there is always the risk that the funding target might not be reached and so this could affect the production of STORIED Issue 2. With the coronavirus pandemic still affecting travel and daily life, there is a risk that our travel pans, even within Japan may be postponed, but we endeavour to safely and legally embark upon trips for content creation, following all rules and regulations in place. 

For anyone investing in a subscription, we feel that we have to be clear that we can only deliver the full set if we sell enough of our first issues. It is our aim to go above and beyond, creating some truly compelling content, to make sure that we achieve this goal. We are confident in our work, though there is always a small risk of this happening. 

We are also aware that with the pandemic still causing havoc around the world, this could cause problems for STORIED, as for many others. This could include anything from delays to travel restrictions. We are working with a team of contributors on the ground here and a printer that has the ability to stay open whilst maintaining safe social distancing. We’re also sorry, but we may still experience some delays in postage whilst many logistics methods are still changing on a regular basis throughout the world.

updates.update_content:
It has been quite a journey so far, navigating the path to releasing our very first issue of STORIED. Just over a year ago, we had to idea to create an outlet for us to tell intimate tales of everyday life and culture from across Japan. After six months of preparing and planning, we launched our online journal at the end of last year, and in January, we turned our attention to print. Volume One, The Kyoto Issue, is an ode to the place that we call home, a love-letter to the lesser-known places of the prefecture, and our first foray into a physical publication.

I have had many a moment where I thought to myself, 'are we really launching a business during a pandemic?!" Yet, here we are! And I am so proud of what we have created with STORIED. Now more than ever, at a time when international travel is out of reach for so many of us, it is of the utmost importance to share the cultural bonds bestowed by travel. My hope is that STORIED brings you closer to Japan. Despite the challenges that the pandemic has presented and the delays that beginning a business brings about, I am thrilled with Volume One and I cannot wait to share it with you. I can promise you that no one has been more frustrated with the delays than I, though I know that we have done everything in our power to make sure that our inaugural issue will be worth the wait. I appreciate every one of you for your continued support and patience.

After careful consideration (and many discussions with our printers, contributors, confidantes, and team), we have made the decision to change our cover image to one that we think better reflects the elegance of everyday Kyoto and the cultural heritage of the place we call home. As our first ever print magazine, we wanted this to be a striking yet traditional tribute to Kyoto, and Japan as a whole. We hope you love our new look as much as we do.  I assure you that you can still expect the same carefully curated content inside as before, just with a fresh exterior.

campaign.story:
A sample journal spread from The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe
Keepsake games like The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe are created by the player over the course of the story.

You are the seventh son of a seventh son, and you have forsaken your name. After many trials, you turned your back on your family legend and your inheritance in the hopes of living a simple life. But now, at the reading of your father’s will, you must make a choice: return to your lineage in order to receive a priceless boon, or forever turn your back to what could have been, in order to shed the burden of your destiny.
The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe is a dark, narratively fraught keepsake game about family lineage, desire, and what it means to be honor-bound to legend. Keepsake games, a genre of game newly named and defined by Jeeyon Shim and Shing Yin Khor during their collaboration on Field Guide To Memory, are defined as games created in the spirit of collaboration between the game designer and the player, wherein the player builds a beautiful, memorable artifact through the process of playing the game. Just as no two players’ experiences of play could ever be identical, no two versions of the game will be exactly the same.


In The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe, the keepsake that players create is a messy, memory-laden family album. Honoring both the DIY, black felt marker, cut-and-paste aesthetic of zines from the early 2000s along with Jeeyon’s distinct voice as a writer and game designer, the player will choose one of two journaling options depending on whether they back the print-and-play version or the mobile-only version.


In the print-and-play zine, players print out sections of the game text to literally cut and paste them into a journal or notebook of their choice. The cut outs are numbered but out of order, and over the course of following directions the player will figuratively and tangibly build up the layers of secrets, dark paths, and old wounds that Gideon Blythe and his lineage created in the name of holding on to the family inheritance. A combination of handwritten prompts and player-generated ephemera create the chaotic path of their character’s personal history.

     In the mobile only zine, players follow screen-friendly directions to create a family album with handwritten prompts, sketches, and physical ephemera they already have at home. Using old books, magazines, newspapers, even bills and receipts, black out existing text to create scattered, uneven moments from their past intermingled with their saga. Written to be a related but different experience than the print-and-play zine, the mobile edition uses a combination of handwritten prompts and repurposed household paper goods to create the story of the character’s remembrance of growing up in the shadow of their father.

     Both editions of the zine share the same ending, with the same hard choice.
Example of play, describing the terminal fate of the character's beloved. Each of the house descendant cards has three possible relationships, which you define by blacking out the ones that don't apply.
Example of ephemera, repurposed and added to the family album in the mobile-friendly zine.
There are four different reward levels for The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe:
  The two digital levels are the HEIR and the BENEFICIARY. 
The HEIR, $5 (unlimited), is the print-and-play edition PDF of the game. The BENEFICIARY, $5 (unlimited) is the mobile-friendly edition PDF of the game.
An array of some of the ephemera a backer might receive with one of the physical reward levels.
There are a few limited edition physical reward levels. At these backer levels, players receive both PDF editions of the game along with original art and hand-selected physical ephemera, to be fulfilled and shipped after the release of the PDFs. Once fully backed, these reward levels will not be made again.
The three physical reward levels:
The NOTARY, $35 (strict limit of 60) includes both PDF editions, along with the full color house descendant cards in a 5”x7” envelope of hand-chosen physical ephemera, such as:
A scrap of fabric from your mother’s favorite dress.
Strands of live Spanish moss, in real life lovingly tended and grown by Jeeyon; in fiction, tokens from the witch’s forest where the descendants hold their first trial.
A feather from the golden swan: an omen of true love, and the harbinger of your meeting with your beloved.
A large wooden splinter from a descendant's shattered shield.
Small, ghostly original drawings on the envelope and inner board of the packet kraft paper envelope.
Other odds and ends as inspirations strikes me.
The house descendant cards in play from the NOTARY reward level.
The EXECUTOR, $60 (strict limit of 45) includes both PDF editions, along with the full color house descendant cards in a hand addressed rigid mailer with original art and hand chosen physical ephemera, such as:
Gideon’s last words to his son (your character) written on hand aged paper; each of these letters will be different, and no two players will receive the same message
a Last Will and Testament envelope, custom printed with the game title by Blumberg Excelsior, each with a blood-red original watercolor painting on the front, and sealed with a wax stamp bearing the Blythe family crest: a haloed raven shrouded in leaves.
Feather from the golden swan, an omen of true love and his most prized possession.
A scrap piece of sheet music from your mother’s favorite song.
Other odds and ends of my choosing, as inspiration strikes.
Detail of the wax seal on the custom-engraved envelope bearing Gideon Blythe's will.
The ESTATE, $100 (strict limit of 45) includes everything in the NOTARY and EXECUTOR rewards, along with the key to your inheritance, hung on cloth cut from a dress cut from the dawn sky, which your father had to fetch in order to win your mother’s hand. The inheritance key is iron skeleton key hung on silk chiffon ribbon in blush pink tones, that can serve as a prop or bookmark for future play.
Spread of what an ESTATE level backer might receive.

NOTE ABOUT PHYSICAL REWARDS: All art and ephemera will be sent out well after the PDFs are emailed to backers. Please note the estimated delivery dates before committing to these reward levels. Additionally, art and ephemera rewards are only available domestically in the United States. As leadership of the USPS changes for the better, future Kickstarters may offer international shipping.

About The Designer
Jeeyon Shim is a game designer and outdoor educator based in Oakland, CA. Her work grounds itself in ideas of community and stewardship of the natural world. Her notables include her collaboration with Shing Yin Khor on their connected path game, Field Guide To Memory; 2019 artist in residence at Heart of the Deernicorn in Olympia, WA; and 2019 keynote speaker at Big Bad Con. She is an enthusiastic collector of bones, folktales, old keys, and plants.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Collectively, I’ve successfully completed and fulfilled 2 Kickstarter campaigns totaling over $84,619. While this is my first solo Kickstarter, which could potentially introduce unexpected challenges, the core experience of the game is fully written. Laying out the raw text in both its print-and-play and mobile only formats can reasonably be done within a couple months of the end of this campaign. 

Each of the physical rewards are hand-made by me, and every aspect of their creation, handling, shipping, and fulfillment will be operated out of my home office and PO box. Depending on the scale of reward backing, this may result in an additional unexpected load on my production scale in spite of the hard limits, which could in turn extend shipping timelines.

Because The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe is a keepsake game, so long as players have one of the core game texts and a journal or notebook to write, cut out of, glue ephemera into, and otherwise embellish and play with, they will be able to play the game. 

If you are deathly allergic to cats please do not back the physical reward tiers!

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The descendant cards are printed on uncoated paper and so, if unused and undesired, can be safely recycled.
Sustainable materials
The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe either asks players to print their own materials at home or repurpose existing materials like catalogs or junk mail. Both have low negative environmental impact. The art and ephemera rewards are almost entirely made with materials I already had in my goblin hoard of feathers, fabric, and interesting scrap paper, and the only newly manufactured goods involved are shipping materials, the envelopes for the EXECUTOR and ESTATE rewards, and the Descendant cards.

The cards were printed with a very local printer (located eight blocks away), and I brought them home in a granny cart; the closer to home you can get things made, the lower the carbon footprint is. 

Overall, I feel very good about the environmental impact of this game.

campaign.story:
The world is full of magic. Some we know about, most we don’t. Sometimes, in exceptional circumstances, an ordinary object becomes imbued with magic, giving it strange powers and turning it into a Curio. You are a Collector of Curios. Why? Well, everyone has their reasons...

The Collector is a solo storytelling game/guided creative exercise, inspired by Warehouse 13, The Librarians and Artefact.

The Game
In this game you will take on the role of a Collector of magical items. You will draw cards and look up the corresponding prompts in the tables provided, then let your imagination run wild! You can write and/or draw the magical item you are searching for, as well as the adventures you have as you attempt to obtain it.
This is a game in the loosest sense of the word, a more accurate description might be a guided creative exercise. But either way, it is entirely an excuse to live out your fantasies of being a Warehouse Agent or a Librarian!

What you need to play:
· The Collector zine, either physical or digital edition
· A deck of standard playing cards, jokers included
· Something to write/draw on and with
· Lots of imagination!

The Zine
The printed zine will be a 16 page A6 saddle stitched booklet.
If we reach the initial funding goal of £100, the physical zine will be printed on 160gsm recycled paper, with a 300gsm brown Kraft paper front and back cover.

The Stretch Goals
£250 - UNLOCKED!
If we reach the stretch goal of £250 then the cover of the zine will be upgraded to a 270gsm colour paper (colour to be decided by backer vote) with a holographic foil detail on the front cover. Everybody say ooooooh, shiny! (This will be at no extra cost to backers, the cost of the physical reward will not change.)
£300 - UNLOCKED!
If we reach £300 I will commission the talented artist Ren Fong (@sinksanksockie) to create an illustration which will likely end up being the cover illustration.
£650 - UNLOCKED!
If we reach £650 funding, all backers at a physical reward tier will also receive an A6 notebook in which they can play The Collector. The notebooks will be 48 pages, with a 300gsm brown kraft recycled cover and 90gsm plain white recycled paper inside.
£1000 - TENTATIVELY UNLOCKED!
If we reach £1000 funding I think that will be enough to also have the outer cover of the notebooks printed with shiny foil as well. Although this stretch goal is dependant on my having correctly estimated the shipping costs!

The Rewards
Digital Version - £2
You will receive a digital PDF of the game. In fact you will receive two PDFs, one standard version and one more accessible version with larger print and dyslexia friendly font and colours.
After the campaign is over I will put the digital version of the game up for sale on itch.io, so even if this campaign is not successfully funded you will still be able to get your hands on this digital version if you would like to play.
Physical Version - £4
You will receive a physical copy of the zine in the post (details above) as well as the digital PDF copies.
2 x Physical Version - £8
If you want to get a copy for you and a copy for a friend you can do that here. You will receive 2 physical copies of the Zine, as well as the digital copies.

The Shipping Costs
I am based in the UK and shipping will be via Royal Mail standard post. This means there will not be any tracking available, but it will be much cheaper for you.
Shipping to the UK: £2
Shipping to Europe: £5
Shipping to the rest of the world: £7

updates.update_content: Guys! My dudes! Pals! Buddies! The printed copies of The Collector, and its matching notebooks, have arrived and I could not be happier with how they've turned out.

Well folks, that's it. All the printed copies have now left my hands and made their way out into the world. I feel like a bit like a parent, a little sad that my babies are no longer with me, but proud and happy that they're out in the world, and excited to see what they get up to!
UK Backers - Your copies were sent out on Tuesday so they should be with you really soon if they haven't already arrived!
International Backers - Your copies were sent out this morning, but due to Brexit and that whole global pandemic thingy, I imagine they might take a little longer than normal to reach you. But still, hopefully they will be in your hands soon!

Good evening fellow Collectors. It is with great joy that I am coming in to your inbox to tell you that I have just sent out the download links for you all to download the digital editions of The Collector Zine!
The email will come from itch.io and will include a link to download your copy of the game. I have (I think) set it so that you don't need an itch.io account in order to access the download link.
Drum roll please! I have now received the gorgeous commissioned cover artwork from Ren Fong and I have made a little mock up of how I think it will look with the shiny foil printing... Ta da!

Hi friends! Just a quick one from me to remind those of you who have not yet completed your surveys to do that as soon as possible. If you don't complete your survey I won't know where to send your goodies to!
While I'm here, and so that this update isn't just one sentence long, why not take a moment to check out my friend's super cool Kickstarter project which is currently live - The Bizarre Badger Sett. She's raising funds to produce some cool embroidered patches of her artwork. Check it out!

Well that's a wrap on the funding part of the campaign. I am absolutely blown away by the support you guys have shown me. campaign.story:
The Game
Inspired by some of my favorite games including Death Stranding, Fallout New Vegas, S.T.A.L.K.E.R., and Mad Max; you play as a Courier. The job: transport goods from one location to another while avoiding delays, hazardous traps and anomalies, dangerous weather effects, and those who would steal your precious cargo.
Someone you don't want to meet on the job...
Courier is a solo RPG telling the story of your rise from a lowly single-bag-Courier all the way up to a Legendary Wasteland Deliverer. You will create your own company, logo, and style as you complete delivery jobs across the New North American continent. Along the way you will discover new contacts, jobs, charms, equipment and upgrades to your Courier Rig while growing your reputation as a reliable company.

Each job you complete will reward you Reputation, a cryptocurrency of the near future. The more people respect you for doing a job well done, the higher your Reputation rises. All types of tools, equipment and accessories can be purchased with this currency to prepare you for everything the world has to throw at you. There are many jobs deemed too dangerous for many Couriers, but they need to get done and offer many higher rewards for those with the courage and know-how. 

You get to choose which delivery missions to take, the length of the journey, and what you need to complete it by customizing your character. Along the way you may discover missing cargo left by would-be Couriers, which you can take to deliver at your end point and net extra Reputation or other rewards. Don't forget that dodging strange weather patterns, Scavengers, time-and-space anomalies and difficult terrain are all part of the Couriers job description. Something new lies around each corner...
The Gameplay
This zine will use a deck of standard playing cards, 2D6 dice, a player marker (meeple, coin, token, etc.), and your character sheet. Players will build their play field at the start of each mission. Each time you move a new location is revealed and event occurs - some offering choices for you to make. Each suit (Hearts, Spades, Clubs, Diamonds) will provide a balance of "good" and "bad" events while providing players a different experience each time they setup and play.

Players are rewarded based on the mission difficulty, length, extra cargo they found and original cargo they had to deliver. Exploring more of the world offers more opportunities for a bigger payout and the chance to experience something in the world that you would have missed.

Each choice will boost your skills as a Courier and stay with you through your entire playtime. All information is tracked on your character sheet, which acts as a historical record of you as a Courier and the company you have created in the world. Retire at any time and pick from the legacy list to have a lasting impact on the world for your next playthroughs! 
The Zine
My previous project, Wandering Dreams, was printed in A5 format which I was very happy with for the total length, under 30 pages. I will do the same this time around but with improved paper and print quality to give an overall better feel, both done by a professional Canadian printer company.

Cover will be full colour on front and back. Interior is planned to be printed with black ink on off-white or coloured paper. I am also looking at foil font for the front and back cover if possible through my local printing companies!
Illustrations

Illustrations and artwork will be done by Sammy Winona (they/them). All artwork will be shared through updates over the campaigns length and beyond. Find them on Twitter below:
Sammy Winona / WallNoises - Twitter
Versions
All versions of the game include community copies that will be distributed through Itch.io after all digital copies have been sent out.

Digital Edition - $7 CAD
Includes a digital copy of the game and all stretch goal levels for digital backers.

Physical Edition - $15 CAD
Get a physical and digital copy of the game, plus all stretch goals.

Collector's Edition - $30 CAD
Offered exclusively on Kickstarter, and will include extras such as stickers, additional table prints, and more. All of this will be housed in a custom printed envelope for storage and safe keeping.

Community Copies - Free!
The biggest distribution of my previous project came from Community Copies through itch.io. With every backer, at every level, I will be giving 2 copies to the community at no extra cost for the backers.
Stretch Goals
This project has a small goal in mind but can easily be scaled up for more exciting features and content! The current list:

$801 CAD - Spotify Playlist (All Backers)
Funded + $1! I will celebrate by creating a playlist for all backers on Spotify. This will mainly be the songs I have listened to while creating Courier and fit the ambience of the world I have envisioned.

$1,000 CAD - Additional Character Sheet (All Physical Backers)
2 copies of the character sheet will be included on high quality paper stock for all physical level backers.

$1,250 CAD - Stickers (All Physical Backers)
Featuring chosen sketches from my final collection of art (TBD).

$1,500 CAD - Postcards (All Physical Backers)
Mini-art prints on postcards! 

$2,000 CAD - More Artwork (All Backers)
I will commission more art to be included across the entirety of the zine, allowing for a larger overall zine.

$2,500 CAD - Upgraded Character Sheet (All Backers)
The character sheet will be upgraded with better layouts, art, and paper quality for physical backers.

$3,000 CAD - Anomalies References (All Backers)
A field guide to the anomalies found by Couriers across their travels. This single sided form will be included for all levels, with a physical copy for all physical level backers.

$??? CAD - Custom Courier Meeple (All Physical Backers)
Something I really want to do but am still working on quotes locally. This would be included for all physical level backers.

Even more stretch goals may be added along the way...
Delivery
Shipping prices are:
Canada - $6 CAD
USA - $10 CAD
Rest of the World - $12 CAD

I have finished the draft of the game and its core concepts. Playtesting is set to start soon, where I will get the feedback needed to keep the game simple and fast.

Digital version is aimed at an end of April release for all backer levels. This will be done through email and an itch.io code for redemption (technically 2 copies). The physical edition will be heading out the door to backers worldwide soon after.

All packages will be prepared, packaged, and shipped by myself from my home in Southern Ontario, Canada. Materials will be sent using recyclable mailers or similar to keep weight, prices and carbon footprint down.

campaign.story:
9th Level Games really loves ZINES...
and ZINE QUEST!!! 
Back in November of 2018, LUKE CRANE told us that KICKSTARTER had this crazy idea - and we knew that we needed to be a part of it.  3 years later, here we are - having successfully created 14 ZINE QUEST RPG Volumes*, winning accolades and awards for at least one ZINE**, and we're still having a blast playing around in our favorite format.

* Over ZQ1/2/3 - 9th Level has successfully funded SEVEN Zine Quest projects -A reprint of the original Kobolds Ate My Baby, the Mazes 4 ZINE original set, the Mazes 5 Zine seasonal set, Monster Mix, Rebel Scum, Savage Sisters, and The Very Good Dogs of Chernobyl. 6 games, 14 total Zines. 
** Mazes won the IGDN Award for Best RPG Rules, and was nominated for BEST RULES for the ENNIE AWARDS.  And it's “just” a ZINE. 
ZINEOGRAPHY is a project about our love of RPGS and ZINES - and the only way to truly do that is with a set of zines about zines (aren’t we just so META? LOL). This project can be thought of as a classic “bibliography” - a book of books.  
This would be a zineography - a zine of zines.
The Zineography is a set of 3 zines, covering ZINE QUEST 1, ZINE QUEST 2, and ZINE QUEST 3.  Each volume will feature a list of the funded projects, fun facts, weird commentary, a real foreword by a real creator, and silliness inspired by YEET VS ZINE QUEST (Who is Yeet?)!

Zinequest will contain a listing (old school library style) for each funded ZQ project. Like an index.
(EXAMPLE IMAGE)
Like a great RPG Zine, we will have STATS and CHARTS (that you might even be able roll against).  This Meta Zine will include interesting facts, statistical weirdness, graphs, and observations.  Most will be hardcore, factual infographics, such as:
Total Dollars
Countries of Origin
First Time Creators
Projects We Love
Number of Backers
And some less so, such as:
Zines with Animal Protagonists
NICE! (Projects with exactly 69 Backers)
The Number of Zines that 9th Level Games has backed (it's a scary scary number)

The Zines will include Special Achievements, focus features, and commentary.  In addition, each Zine will have a foreword written by a ZineQuest veteran.

ZQ1 - Luke Crane, RPG Impressario and Founder of Zine Quest
ZQ2 - Jen Adcock, RPG Designer and Zine Quest Apologist
ZQ3 - Marie Enger, Comic artist & creator of Casket Land

We will NOT print or share any of your art or IP without your consent.  However, we WILL list the title of every project as it was entered into Kickstarter and the link to the project (for digital version of the zineography at least).

campaign.story:
A very happy Zinequest to you and yours!
I’ll be making a set of 2 zines this year: the first is a game about psychogeography, and the second is full of activities for navigating the geography of the psyche. They’re not related but then suddenly they are.

Zine #1:
Follow
...is a game I first made and released for my patrons in 2016. It’s a love letter to getting intentionally lost in strange cities, paying a playful kind of attention to one’s surroundings, and to experiencing familiar places in new ways. It’s for one player, but a group could each have their own experiences and then talk about it after. 
Follow is played by interpreting the prompts of a “geographic recipe,” of which several are included. Here’s one typed into the body of this kickstarter page:

A Quiet Darkness
1. Stand until you begin leaning in a direction, & walk that way. 
2. When you reach a lot of information, bear left. 
3. Follow the shadow-direction. 
4. Whistling? 
5. Go away from the big moving things. 
6. Go right around the barrier. 
7. Listening as the sound drops away. 
8. Low down. 
9. A quiet darkness. 

And the rules talk about how to interpret the steps, how to treat the list of prompts like a recipe and make appropriate substitutions for your particular situation. One can experiment with the same recipe in different contexts: imagine how that recipe would play in a public park, or in one’s own living room.
I really like this game, and it's been enjoyed by folks in a variety of places. A college professor uses the game to give incoming students unique moments on their new campus. Here’s a link to a play experience by a flâneur in Oslo.

"With each game Jackson designs, they brilliantly redefine what's possible in storytelling games, and Follow is no exception." Dr. Josh Laison, Mathematics, Willamette University 
As far as the rules text is concerned, I’ve got a few clarifications I want to make, including the addition of several more recipes. But it's mostly done. 


Zine #2:
Following yourself back from the edge of your life
CONTENT WARNING: activities to safely navigate back from suicidal ideation. Maybe this zine is something you’d rather avoid looking at, or maybe it's something to face directly. I bet that folks dealing with other forms of depression and anxiety will also find something useful here.

With the pandemic, loneliness, the climate catastrophe, winter, our personal mental health challenges, and abundant grief for all we’ve already lost, we’re living through a difficult time- and some folks are trying really, really hard to live through it.
I've survived a couple of close folks' suicides and I deal with times of suicidal ideation myself, and I'm holding this weight in my heart and in my arms, and I can carry it. And I'm looking at all this dense emotion through my game designer lens, and I'm working with it, and this is the form it's taking right now.
This is a zine of reframes and activities that might help navigate those difficult paths; to help you walk back from the edge of your life. I’ve got routines that I do when my suicidal ideation kicks up, and this zine includes stuff that I’ve found helpful as well as stuff that a couple of friends have shared with me and new stuff I’ve jotted down as I’ve been pulling ideas together.
In some ways these activities are like the geographic recipes above: the idea is to modify them when necessary so they’re appropriate to your own context and challenges. You’ll probably find some that seem wholesome or fun regardless as to your brain’s mental health challenges, and I’m sure you’ll read some and just shrug, like, why would that be useful. But maybe some will help. 
Hey though: this isn't a robust and complete solution to suicidal ideation, it’s just a zine.
But zines have always been lifelines, have always been ways for folks in turmoil to kindle sparks of hope inside themselves and take steps into a previously unimagined future. Much thanks to those zinesters who helped me get through my younger years. It wasn’t easy.


The Zines Themselves
Both of these zines will be simultaneously ULTRA FANCY and EXQUISITELY SHABBY, insomuch as I’ll be revisiting the punk aesthetics of my early zinester days but sparkling them up with a bunch of foil accents which I am EXTREMELY excited about.
Currently each zine is 36 pages, we’ll see if that changes.
The two are going to be a very handsome set together, sharing a design aesthetic & maybe a few other details.
Black & white & shiny, mmmm.
The pdfs won’t be, like, shiny due to, you know, technology.
But they’ll be great too in their own ways.


Who’s Doing This
I’m Jackson Tegu, I make games (patreon.com/jacksontegu) and I’ve made a lot of other things at various points, including zines. I even did zine-making workshops at a youth center we all hung around at. Uh, I’m non-binary, and that’s like kinda new for me to share. (he or they) Wooo. I care very, very much about people and play and connection, and this winter has really been rather incredibly hard, but I’m still here, and if you’re reading this then you’re still here too, and if that deserves applause then I’m applauding.
I’m working with Aven from Tabletop Hotdish to print these two zines, and ey explained how the magic sparkly process works and my eyes lit right up. The excuse to work with em is a big part of why this project is actually coming to light. Tabletop Hotdish will also be handling the physical mail out.
The original pixel art logo was made by Graypawn, and seeing it in his ‘unused’ folder (when i visited him at a print shop where he worked, how classic) was the spark which started this project years ago. Thanks, Grapes!
There’ll be some zine-y illustrations by a dear old punk friend who has barely succeeded in remaining alive on a few occasions, and I’m so fucking glad they’re still with us. They’re deciding if they’ll remain anonymous on this project.
Maybe there’ll be a few doodles and photos by me, or by other folks? I’m flowing with the process, we’ll see how it goes.
campaign.risks:

Maybe I’ll be crushed by depression and never finish a game again. But somehow I peel myself off the floor pretty much every month to publish a new game via my patreon, so probably this won’t happen. 

Maybe my perfectionism will freeze out my ability to move forward on this. Ok, but Aha! I’ve given myself permission to make it exquisitely shabby, so I’ll just bathe in the errors and be pleased about it. #LifeHacks 

What if the USPS gets shut down by the Postmaster General? Oh I don’t think that’s happening anymore. 

Wait, what if the foil accents don’t heat-set properly and flake off quickly or gradually? Baby, this wretched old world tries to take the sparkle off of all of us, and you can turn your pages real gently, and you can enjoy the shine while it lasts, and you can also just break out the crayons and add some new accents when the old ones fall away.

campaign.story:
Glimmer's Rim is a psychedelic island hexcrawl designed as a stopgap adventure to use when your players hop onto a ship and sail off toward an unfinished corner of your map.
You were lost too far out to hope for. You'd just crossed over the Abyssal Shelf when a storm rose up from nowhere. The Sea batted your two-masted Ringrunner like a mouse in Her paws, and you went overboard without anyone's notice. Heedless, your little ship left you to drown in dark water., but that was not to be your fate. You were seized by a writhing, barnacled limb and shoved past wiry baleen. Eaten. Nestled, for a time, in a diaphanous bladder—you felt the dive, the pressure, and the scraping as your gelatinous prison slipped through a crack in the sea floor.  Then you were coughed out onto alien sand. Foreign surf lapped at your feet. Unknown stars hung above in an endless twilight.

Welcome to Glimmer's Rim.

No one finds themselves idly upon these shores. It is the island where the Ocean hides her heart, and she guards it jealously. A desert isle whose sand is sewn with gold, jewels and the bones of empires. Come and find your fortune. Escape, if you can.
The Rim is a gonzo treasure-trove of an island at the bottom of the sea, with ~25 distinct hexes and a short dungeon to explore. The players will find themselves the newly acquired pets of the Salt Mother, who is the sea. In search of a way home they will encounter ancient truths, unholy horrors and enough priceless artifacts that their escape will surely not go unnoticed by the god that they are robbing.

Our goal with Glimmer's Rim is to create an adventure that is both practical in function and deeply enjoyable to read through. The hexcrawl is designed to be a systemless, free-form environment with memorable anchors that allow referees to quickly ingest a space and allow their players to explore it. The hexes are less important as a codification of space and distance, and more as a boundary within which the players will always find:

 Something to interact with,
Something obvious to explore, 
& something hidden to find. 

On a hex-by-hex basis the referee should be able to rationalize "the next logical thing happen" upon each future visit and find plenty of fun interplay between hexes. It's like a pointcrawl with maximum interconnectivity.

 There will be dope black & white art on (almost) every spread, maps for the island and the corpse-dungeon that lies beneath it,  and monster stat cards for both 5e and a more easily-adaptable OSR system (Probably Labyrinth Lord or DCC but if y'all have strong enough opinions on that front leave us a comment and we'll take it into consideration).


WIP of a spread from the Dunes showing layout, content & style

So. What do you get when you buy Glimmer's Rim? Here's the breakdown:
An easily utilized/repurposed/cannibalized pocket domain of a Sea God.
A handful of misfit NPCs who's personalities engage and clash with each other--The Mockingbird, a clockwork mimic; Tuppence & Ponder, twin crustacean booksellers; Jacquese, a nautical storyteller, compelled to appear guilty of all crimes.
 ~30 bizarre & unique monsters that each have a novel effect on combat, including the Trapdoor Komodo, a swarm of Psychotropic Damselflies , & the Pariah Bear. 
 Tables for useful, distinguishing artifacts & evocative treasure.
Four distinct areas to explore, each subdivided into their own areas of interest.
Each of these four areas has its own ecology, dangers, mysteries, and enticements:

The Dunes--A shining, technicolor crescent of beach, lapped by the wine-dark waters of the bay. Each scoop of sand holds coin and gem, painted china, chiseled marbled, hammered bronze. Statues poke scatter-shod in basalt mazes and pastel swirls of coral creep up the beach to breath salt air. A giant rusted cage sits half-buried at the treeline, and this is where the civilized castaways make their home.

Far to the south, the brave may find a hidden cave yawn from between the ill-fitting embrace of two frozen waves of magma. Inside, there is truth to be found, hidden in natural mirrors of black glass.
Midnight Pit by Robert Allen Burns


Bayou Vesper--Where roots soak black in stagnant silt, their rotten husks adorned in purple flowers. The scent of ripe persimmon steeps heavy in hot air.  Sick-sweet spice glints in the still water, eddying itself in secret patterns. Even skin contact is enough to loose your mind of the fetters of sanity. This is the realm of Dame Bailfaisante, The Exalted Maw, and the whole swamp is held in a phantasm of her creation. Even the trees sway and the earth itself hums to her tune.

 Deep within the bayou a light flashes through the vines, its colour indescribable. It is the knucklebone of a stillborn god, and no sun will bear to look upon it.

The Heliophage by Robert Allen Burns
The Tangle--The gnarled tail of a world-splitting tree reaches out its seed-encrusted roots like twisting, bony fingers  up into the eternal dusk. The pitiless thicket knots its branches ever tighter unto its center; where a core of bent bark spits loose a mountainous alien limb of fossil stone. The crook of an arm? A bent knee? Perhaps it is high conceit to presume a form familiar to that of a man.

Somewhere in this labyrinthine corpse of a jungle, hides the last vestiges of the Salt-Pact. They kidnap, hunt or entice their victims, only wanting them for their meat. Flesh, bone, viscera and sinew--all grisly fuel to reanimate the mortal remains of their beloved Salt Mother. Speaking of...
Charm Tree by Robert Allen Burns


Mother's Embrace--A cramped dungeon inside the Salt Mother's petrified corpse. At it's center lies the very core of the Rim, and the Salt Mother herself--The Heart of The Sea. The effects of the Pact's perverse sorcery are evident everywhere, and the Saltborn better hurry. The Pact isn't far from completing it's goals, and that's sure to enrage the Salt Mother. She shed her bones long ago. She had no desire to be returned unto them.

She is The Sea now.



Check out a sample PDF of The Dunes:
If you want to see more of our art & writing:
 We'll also be releasing some random sneak peeks throughout the campaign on our social media, so if you want some freebie monsters and items or to take a look at some of the sketches you can get by backing the $45 tier, you can check that out here:

 GLASS//CUTTER INSTAGRAM 
 GLASS//CUTTER TWITTER 
 TYLER'S TWITTER 
Mock-up of the "Revelers 'Neath the Star-Stone" tier
Since the planned page count for Glimmer's Rim stretches a little past the comfort zone of our current guillotine cutter & book stapler, we'll be printing our book via Mixam. If you're a regular purchaser of RPG zines, I bet you've already got some of their work on your bookshelf. Since I've never had any problems with their printing in the stuff I've purchased from others, that's what we're going with. 

Robbie has kindly offered his time to do some sketches for backers who throw us a couple extra bucks. They'll all be thematically linked to the Rim, being monsters, or characters, items or landmarks. 
Original inks for the "Bearers of Welcomed Flesh" tier. Cards and map are included in this tier!

We also have some original art from the book available for people who want to throw us some real cash.

Right now, we only have two stretch goals planned:

 REACHED! $2000 - A Real Boy Map 
It will be something that looks diegetic; like a prop from the world.  Marked up and full of notes from a past adventurer of the Rim. physical backers can expect a folded 11x17. It will, of course, also be included in pdf form for the Saltborn. 

Our maps will be drawn by our good friend Qwynto! (https://www.qwynto.com/)

 REACHED! $3500 - Individual Stat Cards 
 Each monster will get it's own separate stat card so you can run 'em quick and easy at the table! They'll each be printed on tarot-dimension playing cards with art on one side (where applicable) and stats on the other.
Mock up of the 5e Stat Card for Myrka--a drowned revenant
Because Kickstarter makes it hard to indicate what tiers get cards once launched here's a list of what tiers you can back & expect cards:
Revelers 'Neath the Star-Stone
Bearers of Welcomed Flesh
Zealous Librarians (Retailer)
Faces of Dead Gods
The Rukh
A Waterlogged Chest of Books

 $5000 - A Soundtrack! 
Me & Robbie will produce four ambient, looping tracks--one for each area of the Rim! 
The Rookery by Robert Allen Burns

If you guys just love-bomb us with money, we'll come up with some more stretch goals, but we don't want to run into the Kickstarter trap of promising so much that the campaign gets slogged down in its newfound grandiosity. 
The production team for Glimmer's Rim is just about as small as a team can be. We are:

Robert Allen Burns: Art & Design

Tyler Lamb (me!): Writing, Editing, Layout, Cartography.

And that's it! Per our stretch goals, we may bring in some more talent if we get enough attention, but for the most part it's a two-person team. Right now, I've got about 10,000 words done, which puts me at about halfway to completion. Robbie's got ~1/3rd of the art done. We want to be up front with you about how much work is left, but we feel we've got a reasonable timeline set for the campaign. Part of the beauty of Zine Quest (for us) is that we can make room in our freelancing schedule to knock out this adventure faster than we otherwise could.

Our tentative Schedule looks like this:
March - Kickstarter wraps, full draft of writing is completed.
April - Maps finished, Playtesting begins
May & June -  First round of edits, Beta tests, Final edit.
July - Art complete, Final Layout complete.
August - Trial print & revisions if necessary.
September - Start Shipping.
Billets by Robert Allen Burns
Our current shipping rates are $5 for US shipping and $12 for International.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The positive side of the logistical worries is that me and Robbie are experienced with producing and printing physical media. We've made comics and zines our entire adult lives. The real risks come with shipping on this scale, which we've never really dealt with before. To compensate, we've factored mistakes into our planning. Delays, pricing issues, etc. We figured we'd run across at least one of these at some point in our first Kickstarter, and we're ready to deal with them as they crop up.
