campaign.story:
Nomadict Magazine - Issue.1

Nomadict magazine is a high-quality printed coffee-table book that approaches travel and landscape photography in a community-centered way. The magazine dives into the stories and adventures of the most talented landscape photographers of our time, all of them having a unique set of experiences from which they have learnt from to become better professionals and human beings. Are exactly those tipping points which make their stories unique. While their words are full of wisdom, through their images these creators invite us into their lives. 
CONTENT & ARTISTS
Alex Stead - @alex_stead: Long format interview including many photography & travel tips, editing incl. b/a, how to go from passion to profession, client work, etc.
Asa Steinars - @asa_steinars: Icelandic female photographer in a male dominated sector, Iceland through the eyes of a local, vanlife, from office job to entrepreneur and freelance creator 
Andrea Ference - @vagabondhearts: Everything on back country camping 101, how to get started, safety & comfort items, sustainable camping principles, physical preparation and mental strength, Andrea's sources of happiness.
The Intercultural Nomad, an article about the history of nomadism, the importance of indigenous communities then and now and the impact of ethnic tourism. Including complementary interviews with travel photographer Cristoforo Perrone (@cristoforoperrone) and humanitarian documentary photographer Sebastian (@photosooky).
Nomadict Must Reads: A handful of the best stories shared this year on Nomadict. Inspiring and thought-provoking stories that invite you to reflect and delve deeper in the notion of travel and photography.
Exclusive soundtracks created by musician @javiwilliamss for a few of the interviews and stories, stimulating your imagination, creativity and inviting you to take your time and relax. 
Four hidden treasures of Russia by @alexskalin: full page photographs from the most epic locations in Russia.
Best of the Week gallery: the 52 winners of 2020 are showcased in the magazine together with the most inspiring quotes and lessons shared by the winners, a few highlighted stories and of course the story behind the winning photograph including the secret of the winner's editing process! 
A interactive map of Central Norway with more than 45 photography spots and the GPS coordinates! By scanning the QR you will directly be virtually transported to Norway, allowing you to prepare your next adventurous trip. 

Celebrating the modern, nomadic lifestyle as a culture, the magazine showcases the most interesting individuals and their background to inspire those who follow the same passion. But it is so much more!

Nomadict magazine is the bridge 
The Nomadict magazine is filling the gap between the nostalgia of an old travel journal, an atlas or an expedition diary and the desires of a modern traveller in the digital age. By enhancing the written content in the magazine with digital assets such as musical pieces exclusively composed to complement our stories, additional media through QR-codes or links to further reads, we create a perfect bridge between the analog and the digital to guide the reader through both worlds. 
Community centered
Building a magazine on and around a community brings strong identification with it. People are consumers and contributors at the same time, which follows the concept of our modern social media platforms. Topics are chosen by the interests of the community or are completely built around them. Stories can start on a digital platform and then find their continuation in the magazine and the other way around. This culminates in the cover that is being chosen by the community over a year-long contest.
Highly aesthetical
Photography is a very visual medium and its creators aim to achieve the most aesthetically pleasing outcome. We follow the same aspiration for beauty in the design of the magazine itself to present the photographs in a coequal way to the reader and match the high standards of our contributors. It comes in the style of a coffee-table book and convinces through a lot of love to details. 
Story focussed
In the days of instagram, photographers have found a great platform to present their work to the world. The fast paced consumption behavior of its users can become a crucial point though. Often times, it leads to a lack of background information to a certain picture that doesn‘t reach the consumer because of the way they consume or it is not even provided by the creator. We do the work here for you and cherrypick the very best stories behind the most stunning photographs and their creators.
Creating value
As photographers and travel enthusiasts are always searching to improve, gain knowledge or find the next adventure, we want to assist them on their way and provide them with real value to achieve their goals. Embedded into our inspirational stories, we share helpful bits and pieces from the professionals with you. With tips and tricks all around traveling, photography and editing, making your passion a business or by providing precise locations of pictures featured in the magazine, we help the reader to find the right direction to follow their passion.
Timeless
We don‘t build our stories upon current events, we create history that last. We don‘t focus too much on gear that might be outdated in a while, but the story and emotion that was created using it. We focus on the philosophy and mindset of a real traveller or professional creative. The lifespan and relevance of the magazine is therefore much bigger.
Ad free 
An ad free magazine allows the reader to enjoy a pure experience from start to end. In this magazine there are no distractions, it is only about maximizing the experience of the reader. This is why you will find among many other things, three exclusive soundtracks for the different stories carefully created to enjoy the magazine at its best. 
Comic
We have created a comic based on a well-known landscape photographer, Alex Stead. He is the main character of the comic, together with Noma, a young boy who is impressed by Alex and his camera. He secretly joins Alex on his hike toward a legendary sunrise spot in the mountains, until Noma gets in trouble and needs Alex' help...  

What will you receive when you support the project?
*The Rewards included in the different packages 

 1) The digital magazine:
 (camera and compass not included)

2) The printed issue and the digital version: 
 (camera and compass not included)

 3) The printed issue, a limited edition comic carefully created for this first printed magazine and the digital version: 
(camera and compass not included)

 4) The printed issue, a limited edition comic, a print* of your choice by Daniel Reuber (@skeye_photo) and the digital version: 
 (camera, compass and frame of the print not included) *find print choices further down

 5) The printed issue, a limited edition comic, a print* of your choice by Daniel Reuber (@skeye_photo), an honorable mention in the magazine and the digital version:  
 (camera, compass and frame of the print not included) *find print below
If you purchase the Art Bundle, you can choose one out of these four prints
 Funding Goals 
6.300€ - Hooray! Funding successful! We can cover our costs. 

7.500€ - We can pay the people who worked on the magazine for months and compensate the printing material by donating to a nature preserving project. 

10.000€ - We can pay our contributors who kindly shared their images for this first issue and who so enthusiastically answered our questions.  

15.000€ - We will immediately start producing the second issue of the magazine. You will be able to decide with us on the topics. 

25.000€ - We pay shipping costs for every single order. 
Personal Message about the existence of Nomadict
Alejandro: "Nomadict was born to give a voice to a growing community of travelers and landscape photographers. I still remember when I was traveling and shooting four years ago, when I realized there were no platforms sharing the stories of some of the most inspiring content creators on social media. 
Moved by a strong curiosity, I thought to myself: "Maybe I can change that?" 

Aletta: "Meanwhile we have shared over 300 unique stories, originally told in different languages and by people with very diverse backgrounds, but all united by a love for the natural world and a passion for nature.
To us it is very special to be somehow invited into the life of photographers, to their artistic journey characterized by exploration, adventure and self discovery. Each story is a piece of wisdom, obtained through life experiences, sending out a message. 
At Nomadict we want to give a stage to photographers to tell their story, visually and in words, to share learning and inspiration."

Alejandro: "That is exactly what makes this first issue special. We have put together for you some of the most inspiring stories and interviews of the year, and combined those with exclusive and valuable content so you can grow both professionally and personally, and hopefully be inspired to keep following your passion. So, if you think about it, we have created this magazine together with the community, for the community and for everyone who wants to become part of it."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Finishing the magazine: 
We try our best and work extra time in, but delays can happen. We are working together with many different creators for the content of our magazine and it is challenging to manage sometimes - we want to respect their personal time and jobs as well and give them realistic deadlines that match our needs and their possibilities.

Printing:
Printing delays is our biggest challenge. and we also depend on the schedule of the printer. We are managing deadlines with our creators but we cannot control their processes. We keep giving updates to let everyone know at what stage we are and what the cause of any possible delay is. 

Delivery: 
Due to the current pandemic, some countries such as Australia or Bolivia have closed their borders and just allow 'priority packages' into their land. If you are in one of those countries, please be aware that we may not be able to ship your reward immediately. Please check what is the current situation in your home country before you decide to contribute.

As we are not personally delivering the magazines, there's also limited control over correct delivery by the third parties. We will do the best from our side to check addresses and obtain complete information in order to increase the chance of correct delivery.

Hello supporters!
You might have started wondering how we are advancing with the magazine or how long it is going to take... Well, here we are to give you an update! 
We just sent the magazine to the printer to make a print proof (a preliminary version of the magazine to check prior to production). The printer will turn the digital file that we have been working on for so long from behind our computer screens, into ONE tangible magazine that we can finally hold in our hands; read of the carefully chosen quality paper and smell the freshly printed pages.

We are getting SO close!
Do you know that feeling of excitement the days, even weeks before something great is going to happen? Well, that's how we are feeling! We are working on the content of the very last page of the magazine, while we have started reviewing all the pages. This collection is available as an affordable paperback and as a signed deluxe hardcover edition. We also have four signed prints available. Plus, there’s a bonus Kickstarter ex-libris bookplate that serves as a special “thank you” for those who make a book pledge. Enjoy the samples and details below. Thank you for visiting!
Stretch Goal #1 Unlocked! We are adding 16 more pages to the book. The paperback is now 144 pages. The hardcover edition is now 160 pages!

Revealing narratives bring forth the essence behind Allen's visually arresting images. 
Unique to hardcover edition is a bonus 16-page section that includes a rare glimpse into Allen’s studio. This will showcase an in-depth exploration of his creative process that will include sketches and preliminaries. Allen will show the process of a finished piece from sketch to final drawing with informative commentary for the fan and student to enjoy.

Covenant: The Art of Allen Williams is a 144-page paperback and 160-page signed deluxe hardcover collection at 9 x 12 inches.
Covenant boasts the first collection of Allen’s personal drawings and paintings. Each of his fantastical characters is accompanied by a line of text, a poem or a brief story that captures their essence. These visual narratives are pulled to the surface through Allen’s renowned mastery of storytelling and his use of graphite, pencil and oils. The result is a fascinating journey into the mind of this intriguing artist.
Covenant Interior Sample Art
Allen’s strength comes from his mystical connection to his work. He views himself as a guardian and creates artistic personas that serve the well-being of others. At first sight, his mythological characters may look odd, monstrous or grotesque. Yet they represent the good that can be found when you look below the surface of an individual. Allen has always liked the underside of things. He embraces the bits of mortality that poke out from under the skin. The artwork collected here addresses Allen’s need to face the challenges that surround him while projecting himself into the art. He is driven by creating images based on the strength of an individual’s actions, regardless of how they may be perceived for not conforming to society’s semblance of beauty.
Covenant Interior Sample Art
All prints are available as add-ons to your book pledge. When you select the paperback or the hardcover book, you can add the print(s) that you would like during the checkout and payment process. Feel free to message us if you need help.

These signed luxurious museum quality giclée prints featuring the art of Allen Williams are available as add-ons to your book pledge. There are four images to choose from. These prints utilizes 290 gsm acid free matte paper that is printed with archival and fade resistant inks.
"The Withered Man" -- 13 x 19" -- $50.00 -- Signed Print.
"The Lotus King" -- 13 x 19" -- $50.00 -- Signed Print.
"One Hour Past the Setting of the Sun" -- 13 x 19" -- $50.00 -- Signed Print.
"The Good Dog" -- 18 x 24" -- $75.00 -- Signed Print.
Allen Williams in his studio. Photo by Danin Drahos.
Allen Williams is an award-winning illustrator, concept designer and fine artist. From a young age, he found that a pencil and paper provided an escape and a refuge. Now internationally known, Allen has applied his talents to everything from illustration for gaming companies and book covers to concept work for major motion pictures and television. His vision for such projects ranges from illustration to concept work, as well as creature and character designs.
Allen’s personal work has a strong basis in reality but always flows into otherworldly aspects. He primarily works in graphite, gouache and oils. Multilayered images arise in his work, in which the fragility and instability of our seemingly certain reality is questioned. Allen’s drawings directly respond to his surrounding environment, and he uses everyday experiences and objects as a starting point for many of his pieces. These often feature framed instances and objects that would go unnoticed in their original context. By choosing mainly formal solutions, Allen tries to develop forms that do not follow logical criteria but are based only on subjective associations and formal parallels; these are meant to incite the viewer to make new personal associations within his work.

campaign.story:
Made with your help
We have spent over 18 months researching and developing the Papyrus notebooks. We asked questions and received tons of feedback from members of a variety of communities on what they like (and hate) about their note taking habits.

Mainstream notebooks have their downsides and flaws :
Thus, we don't want to reinvent the wheel, but rather bring back the ancient papyrus format with a touch of modernity, by combining something close to the traditional papyrus format with today’s notebook. This would make us achieve our main goal : freeing your mind and unleashing your full creative and intellectual potential
Now how are we going to achieve that?
We combine the notebooks you know and  the Egyptian paper you missed out on.
Papyrus
It's simple:  we removed every constraint that holds you back from achieving this with traditional notebooks and notepads. Only then, are you able to reduce the gap between your mind and the paper. Stop thinking about when to turn the page, skip the line, or how to juxtapose your pages, and focus on what’s essential.
The real champion of notebooks
Okay, we get it, a big piece of paper is not exciting enough, but…
Our paper is the perfect combination between strength and thinness, made to last forever yet be light enough.

The sum of the density and surface treatment makes your pen glide across the surface. This, in addition to the right dosage of fast drying and controlled absorption, guarantees sharp lines and no more runny ink. 
The high opacity ensures a high readability on both sides.
Surface resistance allows corrections without tearing.
No ghosting with fountain pen

No more limits, you are in full control of the shape of your paper, fold it according to your needs.

It allows you to display an infinity of combinations of pages so that you always have an eye on the essentials whilst having plenty of space to engrave your knowledge.
No more getting to the bottom of the page. No more turning the page.
For example, you can display pages 1-2, 123,1234, 234,178 etc.
Help make the Papyrus notebook a reality by picking a reward tier below, and backing this Kickstarter!

campaign.story:
When you were younger and happier, you often spent hours in the woods, sitting quietly and drawing. Over time, you did it less and less: first homework, then the stress of a new job, then...you just didn’t. You were good at drawing once. Never great, but good—and it brought you so much joy. Joy is hard for you to come by these days.

So begins your journey in below, a solo journaling game about getting lost in a strange, uncomfortable place. Over the course of 10 days, you'll explore a remote area you find yourself trapped in. In responding to the journaling prompts, players are encouraged to draw parts of their responses, even if you don't think that your drawing skills are good. This is a game for you about falling out of your comfort zone.
It's important that players understand that below addresses many topics that could be upsetting to players. The narrative of the game addresses depression through metaphor, and as such, for players who aren't in a good place mentally, it may not be the game for you right now.
In below, you play someone exploring an area they used to love but no longer feel connected to. At the end of the first day, you fall into a dark, unfamiliar region and cannot find a way out. Over the course of the ten days of the game, you'll keep a record of your explorations through words and images as you endure.
Content Warnings: below addresses, through metaphor, depression and the disconnection that comes along with it. There are prompts that address falling, being lost, not having food or water, nearly drowning, and harm to an animal caused by predation and its resulting suffering.

The game will be emailed to you on December 21st, the darkest day of the year. (The rewards say January, but that's because Kickstarter doesn't allow the rewards to be promised for the same month as the campaign.)
The writing for the game is finished, and I'm currently doing final playtesting on it. It will be ready to go before the end of the campaign.
In terms of art, there's only the cover image for Fergus to do, and they've already taken care of that.
Fergus Ferguson (any pronouns) - Cover Art - is a student and artist, dual majoring in computer science and fine arts at Tufts University. When they are not studying or drawing, they like to play tabletop games, read sci-fi, and tell everyone how great their betta fish is. They can be found on Twitter (@fergusfergyferg).
Doug Levandowski (he/him) - Design, Writing & Layout - is a teacher and game designer from New Jersey. He has worked on larger RPGs such as Kids on Bikes, Teens in Space, and Kids on Brooms as well as Kickstarter-delivered ones like The Wishing Sigil, Agents of Dice-Ception, and, most recently, Arcane Zoo. He can be found on Twitter (@levzilla).

campaign.story:
This‌ ‌catchy,‌ ‌witty‌ ‌compilation‌ ‌of‌ ‌inventions,‌ ‌filled‌ ‌with‌ ‌beautiful‌ ‌illustrations,‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌wonderful‌ ‌gift‌ ‌for‌ ‌collectors,‌ ‌enthusiasts,‌ ‌and‌ ‌curious‌ ‌minds.‌
Story
Have you ever imagined visiting the past with full knowledge of modern information and technology? If you told people from the Middle Ages or Ancient Egypt about a telephone, a car, or electricity, they would take you for a deity or a superhero. But do you actually know how these things work?
As a child, before bed, I used to imagine with my dad what things like bowstrings would be made of in ancient times. In the morning, looking it up, we would be startled to discover that bowstrings were made of veins and if you wanted instead to make one from gunpowder ingredients you had to urinate on hay!

As I got older, I got into mechanics and discovered that many apparently simple things are based on brilliant ideas. All the discoveries and inventions that seemed incredible and almost magical when I was a child actually were just as fantastical as I imagined!

I realized that most people knew very little about how such inventions of our civilization as a plow, a mill, a blast furnace or glass are made and how they work. I began making a list of the most amazing inventions I would like to tell my children about. Later I added illustrations, which became more and more bizarre and mysterious. After some time, I finished a draft of The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries. 

Now I want to share this book with everyone who hasn’t lost their juvenile curiosity and love for mystery. If you are as fascinated by technical, military, medical and artistic inventions as I am, you definitely will love The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries and The Ultimate Guide to Rebuilding a Civilization. This book is an illustrated encyclopedia of mechanisms, processes and materials that have played a significant role in human history.
There is no other book like this. Currently, information about inventions is scattered here and there in boring textbooks and manuals that are neither understandable nor inspiring. The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries presents the most meaningful facts about our culture combined with out-of-this-world ideas and fabulous illustrations. It is the first treatise of its kind on these spectacular magical inventions. Only with your help will we  be able to create this exceptional book.
Vsevolod  Co-founder of The Book

The Book is a unique artifact similar to the most mysterious and mantic books of humankind. The visual symbolism of the book connects it to the prominent fifteen-century Voynich manuscript while its uncommon and original ideas are similar to the Summa Technologiae of Stanisław Lem. The book is also influenced by the aesthetics of the renowned Codex Seraphinianus. The Ultimate Guide is a real masterpiece and an endless source of inspiration.

On the pages of The Ultimate Guide you will find visual instructions for making handy mechanisms and materials in case you lose them or forget. With over 400 pages of detailed and catchy illustrations, you will forget about everything and bury yourself in the book. You won’t stop thinking of what you saw.
This section is all about how to be healthy, cheerful, and fresh. Here you’ll find out how to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation without getting punched in the nose. You’ll learn how to remove your appendix if you don’t need it anymore. We’ll tell you which mushrooms are tasty and which mushrooms are fun (what are mushrooms and what are shrooms). We’ll teach you yoga and Chinese needle therapy. Believe us, all of this knowledge will come in handy in the ruins of the post-apocalyptic world! (not to mention in the modern world, given the cost of medical insurance). We’ll also explain how to make gypsum, glue, penicillin or even all three together from scratch.
The whole world is a big chemistry lab and the only limit here is your lack of knowledge. If there’s sand under your feet, you can make glass. If you see trees around you, it’s a step from there to making paper. The magic of our civilization, which is electricity, can also be made from easily accessible materials. There are tons of ways to make it and we’ll reveal the most original one.
Researchers have concluded that human brain development was always influenced by laziness and greed. We want to have as much as possible with minimal effort and that’s what makes us geniuses. Mills and water pumps will do the work for you. The combustion engine will help you in traveling any distance. Cameras made of boxes and paper with photosensitive surfaces will immortalize your successes
In all the worlds of the Multiverse in which this book will be published, we’ve agreed that killing people isn’t cool. We wish these inventions never appeared, but still….The trebuchet is pretty darn good. To create saltpeter, which is the main gunpowder component, all it takes is hay and human urine. How long will you have to pee in the pit full of hay? You’ll find this out in The Ultimate Guide. By the way, did you know that the alchemist who discovered gunpowder thought he was creating the elixir of life? Well, if you throw pots full of gunpowder at your enemies, you’ll become immortal (for a while).
The home of ancient man began from fire, so if you don’t want to be dumber than your ancestors you need to learn how to use flint and steel. If all goes smoothly, you’ll be able to build a log house, weave a rug, mould houseware out of clay and build a boat. You’ll learn the art of tying knots and using natural dyes. But above all, you’ll learn how to construct a unique top-class mousetrap, so rodents won’t have any chance. (Failing to do that, read about cat domestication in the Farming section.)

It’s said that wheat domesticated humans rather than the opposite. Agriculture made us who we are today, so in this book you’ll find a detailed description of grain types and animal farming principles. You’ll learn to make fishing nets, help to deliver calves, procure salt and honey. But first you should learn to brew the best-ever wheat beer. (Which will literally be the best beer in the world since you’ll be the only brewer after the fall of civilization)
Life is not only about surviving; it’s also about not dying of boredom. There will be fewer fights in your survivor camp if you give people cards and chess. Your children won’t set fire to your house (built thanks to the instructions of the Hearth and Home section) because they will be playing ball or flying a kite. You’ll become a local movie mogul if you make a phenakistiscope, a device that creates the illusion of motion. By the way! We’ll tell you how to make a vibrator.


There is nothing similar to the sound of the Australian didg. It’s literally the voice of spirits. This musical instrument exists in all the worlds of the Multiverse, so make sure to read a manual on how to make it. The same applies to the jaw harp, which can be found in the history of any nation on the earth and beyond. During your interworld journey a sitar and a bell will come in handy too. Tell whomever you meet about the music theory of our world and don’t forget to ask about their notation too. 

Rituals, traditions, and etiquette are as significant as mechanisms and materials. The most basic and peculiar inventions of human communication were collected in The Ultimate Guide. How do you tie a tie to make a good impression? What is the philosophy behind fashion? What are the rules of setting a table and marking the road? How exactly do you carry out seppuku in the way that will most impress others?
A Dutch philosopher Johan Huizinga in his book Homo Ludens proved that games appeared long before culture. People enjoyed games and invented a gillion of different games in the ensuing thousand years. Many games also keep arcane knowledge. For example, card suits depict archetypes of the human psyche, chessmen talk about the social organization and hierarchy. You’ll be able to rule the whole world if you know how the main games of humanity, such as football or Monopoly, work and what rules they have.

People had not yet invented writing when they discovered that fried meat was much better than raw and that fermented fruit juice dissipated sorrow and made them sleep like a baby. Over time, cooking has become a real art that requires imagination and ingenuity. Asians held raw fish in a pressing machine for weeks to make sushi. Arab nomads occasionally discovered cheese recipe by keeping milk in bags made of sheep’s stomachs. And don’t forget to learn the recipe of the main food invention, which is bread. Without bread you won’t be able to make your new world fully civilized. 
The intriguing illustrations that combine engineering drawings and medieval art depict the structure of devices and materials in many forms throughout the many worlds of the Multiverse. What does it mean? According to The Ultimate Guide, people find new ideas in the world’s information realm rather than come up with new ones. This means that development of these ideas isn’t connected to anything really. They can appear out of the blue in different worlds of the Multiverse.
In one of these worlds, medieval peasants work fields with tills attached to bicycles. In another world, gladiators of the Colosseum fight under stadium lights. There is a world where indium-gallium alloys are the essence of microelectronics instead of silicon. In one more world zeppelin became the main means of transport when humanity discovered a cheap way to produce helium as opposed to explosive hydrogen. On the pages of The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries you’ll find tons of such examples and probably will think that similar ideas have come to your mind before.
It is made for satisfying curiosity, widening the horizons of your mind, drawing inspiration and teleporting from world to world.
This book will make an excellent gift for all those who are keen on art, technology, history and such puzzling sciences as semiotics and hermeneutics.

The size of The Ultimate Guide is around 13x9 inches and 4.5 pounds. All the pages of the book will be printed on special thick 157gsm paper. This is a high-quality mat art paper, which definitely feels well and holds well. The Ultimate Guide will be a hardcover book and will have stunning matt laminated cover.
The Ultimate Guide contains knowledge of humankind and it can’t come to life without the help of people. We need the support of enthusiasts who believe in the unique future of the human mind.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
We’d like to specify what has been already done since the end of our campaign on Kickstarter in January. The first and most important thing was to assemble the team of professionals. We spent some time looking for illustrators whose drawing style would be convenient and could match with others’ styles. It was a big deal to find writers for this project as soon as our expectations were rather high and we had a huge number of unsuccessful attempts before we could find writers who can perfectly complement their texts with the illustrations. We also searched out for many researches who support both our writers and illustrators with all the needed technical information. We managed to find experts in scientific, medical, technical and social fields who constantly advise us on what information the book should include to provide readers precise and workable instructions. All in all, we have 36 people in our team, about 10 side experts and this number is constantly growing. After that came the second step of our work which unfortunately took more time and turned out to be more complicated than we expected. We all had to get used to each other to stabilize and optimize the working process. The problem on the technical side was that we’re an international team of nearly 40 people living in different countries all over the world. Time lag challenged our determination and commitment to work together on this amazing project. Finally, we won this fight but there were many others yet to come. Sometimes it was a hard time for us to learn to hear each other, we could meet every day and argue about many small and insignificant thing for hours. We still meet every day but now we can proudly say that our meetings are more productive than ever before. At last, making process is synchronized and we’re actively working on the book. We’ve made a good progress which you can see on this infographic:

Dear backers, 
It’s time for a new update! First of all, we wanted to thank you for your patience as it’s been a while since our last update.

We want to share the process with you. The Ultimate Guide is a story told by a multinarrator about a multiverse and it seems a great and interesting challenge for us to fulfill this idea.  To bring this concept to life we’re working hardly and experimenting on both levels of the book – illustrations and texts.

We think that the best way to describe our way of working process is to say that we use cut-and-try approach. We try a lot of ideas and we cancel a lot of them to obtain the best result. For example, you can see how each sketch of the Ultimate Guide is being changed and modified multiple times until it becomes a cartoon and then a complete illustration.

Dear backers,

It's time for one more survey since we've promised you a possibility to choose whether you want to place your name or name of your relative/friend in the Ultimate Guide.

We decided on Google Forms as the fastest and the easiest way to collect this information.
Link to the survey: https://forms.gle/sUQEWLnuGuDiAmjy7

Hello everyone!
We are excited to share that we are ready to start sending surveys using Kickbooster. The survey will allow you to confirm your pledge level, confirm your Kickstarter add-ons (which will be visible in your Survey Summary), and provide you with the opportunity to purchase additional add-ons. Please keep an eye out on your inbox for an email from Kickbooster throughout the week while we roll them out.

Hi there!
Not here to disturb you, just wanted you to know that we’re in a deep book production process right now. The book making turned out to be difficult but cool! All in all, our team has 22 people from all over the world and we're proud that we managed to set up this project. We meet online, guide the working process, coordinate the team and get faster in progress.

A month has passed since our Kickstarter campaign ended and we would like to share with you what we have managed to do since then. We have put together a stellar team that will work on the book over the next 8 months and are happy to introduce you….Behold!:

campaign.story:
Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game was released in 2018. It has been translated by Kosmos Verlang in German, Polish, Frech, Italian, Czech and Hungarian under the title of EXIT das buch series of Kosmos EXIT GAMES. 
This second version will include a new gameplay system, new faster website,  and 5+ new puzzles and riddles.  

Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails, will be officially launched on March 2021 on Amazon.
Scattered around the globe, parts of a legendary naval diary.
Writings of an insane mind, while stories speak of a greater mystery filled with sea monsters, nightmares and messages from other dimensions.
Years since its disappearance, the sea legends speak of a dark journey, on a ship long forgotten. 
All that until now.
The missing pages of this journal have been mysteriously put together.
The naval diary appears every now and then on the doorsteps of people who challenge its existence.  It's now the time to see what lies hidden and reveal the ship's final days."
 The basic idea behind Trip 1907 (second edition), is to provide an enhanced game play by limiting the webpage usage, and focus on the hardcopy. In this version the webpage is only for submitting the chapters answers and receiving puzzle hints.
The main differences between Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game and Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails are on the game experience. The new version does not need logging into the website. The passcodes are there to save your progress as well as the sanity system is now embedded inside the book. The passcodes are transformed into game clues and 5 riddles have also been replaced with new ones, along with two Easter Eggs. In this version the book's story will be in the hard copy.
In this version of Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails you will find:
A new, faster, website has been added with no registration required.
The "sanity" token hint exchange system is now on the hard copy. It is up to the players to keep track of their sanity tokens spent, leaving more space to continue the book even if all sanity points are spent.
 Pass codes have been added in order to save the game progress and give a linearity on the game puzzles.
The game story will be on the hard copy instead of the website.
 5 riddles have been replaced with two easter eggs on the hard copy.  
In order to play Trip 1907 (2nd Edition):Dark Sails you will need:
A copy of Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails.
A pencil.
An internet connected device.
A pair of scissors.
In this version you will need to go through 45 chapters of the book, solve the puzzles, submit your answers online and get the passcodes of each chapter.
Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails  is finished. Given previous experience on Kickstarter the game is finished as well as the play-test getting an excellent response from our game testers.  In this way delivery is a primary issue to us and will be done through Amazon & KDP separately for every backer of this project. Main goal is to complete all the shipping process by the first days of January. 
EU countries together with USA and Canada have at the moment an estimation time for dispatching of 5-7 days.
Is Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails an eBook?
Nope, Trip 1907 is  a hard copy book.

Do I need an app to play it?
Nope, all you need is the copy of the book a pen and an internet connection.

Is there a hint system for the riddles?
A hint system is provided on trip1907.com, where players can exchange their sanity tokens for hints.

Are there any additional charges for playing the book?
Nope, once you have purchased your copy there are no additional perks to buy.

What is the language of the game?
English.

Is there a forum to keep up with the riddles?
A forum will be provided for players exchanging ideas over the riddles.

I have the original copy of Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game, should I back this one?
There are changes in 5 [puzzles and gameplay. So if you have played the first version you will only find 5 different riddles. The story and the rest of the riddles remain the same.

When this version will come out so I can buy it?
This version will be launched on February 2021.
Book Game specs:

                 Pages: 170+
                 Puzzles: 45+
                 Artwork pages: 20+

campaign.story:
Dictionary Story is a tale that celebrates the creative potential of the world's most famous reference book. It is a story in which definitions from the dictionary come to life and meet. The story is told and illustrated by using over 230 of the dictionary's own definitions.
For this new 20th anniversary print, which has been completely rewritten and redrawn, we are hoping to print at Nomad Letterpress (home of Whittington Press) in Cheltenham.
 Nomad Letterpress prints from metal type and plates on a wide variety of presses dating from 1830 to 1960 and includes a collection from the Oxford University Press. (What is Letterpress? You can find out here)
The previous Dictionary Story book and print were widely collected, finding their way into libraries such as the British Library UK, the Library of Congress US, Bibliothèque Nationale de France FR, Deutsche Nationalbibliothek DE, as well as museums like the V&A museum UK and The Getty Research Institute USA, MoMA NY and the Tate UK. The original version was soon out of print.
From left to right - 2001, 2006, 2009 and 2014 editions of A Dictionary Story. Designers such as David Pearson, Richard Bonner Morgan and A Practice for Everyday Life have all helped on previous editions.
“Sam Winston is uniquely alert to the way words take their place in the world; in his agile and mischievous fingers, each word and even each letter radiates vivid, graphic personality. Dictionary Story is a fairy tale as concrete poem, a typographical romance, filled with wit and tenderness.”  Marina Warner - Author & Curator 
The idea of a fluid language has been explored throughout Winston's 20 year practice and the project has taken many forms - including a full folded dictionary where he transformed the twenty volumes of the OED into a 80,000 folded page sculpture.
"Dictionary Story has always been close to my heart. I think we don't examine words well enough and presume we all share the same understanding of what things might mean. A Dictionary Story playfully explores this presumption - deep down into the subterranean world of letters and type." Sam Winston
We would love your support in bringing this new story to life. 2020 has been a year where "Fantasy has been mistaken as Fact, Jokes have been reported as News and Literature itself has sometimes slipped into Trivia” [a sample line from the new story]. Your help in supporting a celebratory home for language would be warmly welcomed.
If the project is successful, this would also open the door to a stretch goal of free additional art prints and a new publication all together.
Rewards
Delivery before Christmas is possible, but please message us first, so we can provide a shipping quote and details. Email studio@samwinston.com
Every pledge plants (at least) one tree with TreeSisters - a global women's empowerment and reforestation project. We will update you on tree total at close. 
A Dictionary Book supporter: A classic Dictionary Story artist book and a small ‘Stolen Dictionary’ print
The 2014 Dictionary Story (this version with a beautiful sleeve by the design studio A Practice for Everyday Life). The book comes as three loose accordion sheets housed in a transparent wallet. Plus a completely new 'Stolen Dictionary’ print [approximate size is 6”x8” or 15 x 21cm]. The only trade edition still in print with 500 left of the edition. More images here
A letterpress supporter: New Yorker art print
You will receive a signed limited edition New Yorker Magazine Letterpress Print [edition of 130 with 40 remaining], the classic 2014 Dictionary Story book plus the small reproduction of a 'Stolen Dictionary’ print. The first four backers of this reward will also receive a copy of The New Yorker magazine in which a corresponding article first appeared. More details here
Main Event: The new Letterpress Dictionary Story
You will receive the new signed limited edition Letterpress Dictionary Story print [22 x 29in / 56 x 75cm]. Completely rewritten and redrawn with new characters and definitions. Typeset in Baskerville and printed on 225gsm Zerkall (mould-made & acid free) printmaking paper. Printed by Nomad Letterpress in an edition of 190. A completely new story with new art. You will also receive the classic 2014 Dictionary Story book plus the small reproduction of a ‘Stolen Dictionary’ print.
2nd Main Event: A ‘Stolen Dictionary’ folio
A folio of 3 artist prints:
Letterpress Dictionary Story print 22 x 29in / 56 x 75cm
Full size 'Stolen Dictionary’ print 23 x 31cm / 58 x 79cm
Unique ‘Process Print’ 22 x 29in / 56 x 75cm
All three prints housed in a handmade folio. Editioned, signed and printed on archival paper. Detailed description below.
                Letterpress Dictionary Story   |   Stolen Dictionary   |   Process Print
To make this collage Winston had hand cut hundreds of words from an Oxford Mini Dictionary and arranged them with a glue and knife on a page, trying to match the narrative of the story he had just written.
We’re not sure how literally one should take the often (misquoted) phrase of “bad artists copy, great artists steal”. But there must of been some ‘great artists’ passing through Camberwell College of Art when Winston put this work on display in 2001 - because it disappeared overnight. Fortunately a few black and white reproductions were made and now this is all that remains of this early project - aptly titled a 'Stolen Dictionary’.
There are 10 archival reproductions of this at [23 x 31cm / 58 x 79cm] printed with pigment ink onto Hahnemühle Fine Art Bamboo Natural White 290gsm [90% Bamboo fibre, 10% Cotton] acid free paper.
It’s all part of the process. Multiple drawings, prints, photographs, and screen shots layered onto one sheet of paper. The prints and photographs were taken at different stages of the production process and layered over one another to offer a glimpse into the making process.
There are 10 unique versions of this. Part drawing, part letterpress and part archival digital print. All on on 225gsm Zerkall (mould-made & acid free) printmaking paper.
Original artwork: Hand cut collage 
Commission and keep a unique artwork. Sam will make you a new typographic collage based on the the 2020 Dictionary Story.
Give Sam the opportunity to reimagine the 'Stolen Dictionary' artwork using the same hand cut techniques used in 2000. Approximate size is 23” x 33” / 60 x 85cm. Delivery by end of Summer 2021. Includes studio visit or virtual studio visit.

campaign.story:
You have just received “The Shelley Volumes,” a collection of hollowed-out books left by Mary Shelley (author of Frankenstein) to her son, Florence. In the first volume, you find a message from Mary:
Beneath Mary’s letter you’ll discover a treasure trove of gorgeous hand-written documents, 2D and 3D jigsaw puzzles, mysterious objects and artifacts, and devious challenges. Prove your worth by studying the documents, constructing the jigsaws, and solving the puzzles... and you’ll be treated to a heartbreaking story that culminates in a shocking reimagining of the truth behind Mary Shelley’s famous novel.
Combining the best of escape rooms, board games, and immersive theater, Mother of Frankenstein is a 10-15 hour cooperative gaming experience for between 1 and 6 players, ages 13 and up. Mother of Frankenstein was designed to be as welcoming and fun for newbies as it is rewarding for experts, combining the narrative complexity of a good novel with the physicality and challenge of a puzzle-filled escape room. Throw in a couple of clue-strewn jigsaw puzzles, and our game truly has something for everyone!
Our final stretch(es)!
Stretchy!
Mother of Frankenstein is divided into three volumes. Volume 1 concerns Mary’s teenage years and her education by her iconoclastic father. Players must complete three assignments—poetry, music, and astronomy—each of which is presented in the form of a puzzle. Simultaneously, Mary embarks on a love affair with the dashing (but married) poet Percy Shelley. The course of their courtship is laid out over 15 love letters, though players must read closely to determine the order of events!
In Volume 2, the venue changes to Germany, and Castle Frankenstein, where a fancy ball is being thrown on a balmy night in 1814. Players begin by constructing a 300-piece jigsaw puzzle of the castle’s floorplan, then use it—along with gossip rags, billiard hall schedules, and original drawings by comic book artist Liana Kangas—to track the events of the evening.
Finally, in Volume 3, you’ll construct an epic 3D puzzle of Castle Frankenstein and descend into the secret laboratory hidden therein, where you’ll discover what Mary learned under the tutelage of the famous alchemist who called the place home, and how it inspired her to write what many call the first science fiction novel, Frankenstein.

Liana is known for her covers illustration work on series like Forgotten Home and more! updates.update_userinfo: Man, A Mother's Day Update to "Mother of Frankenstein" Would've Been Great...
updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Happy day-after-Mother's Day. Hope your mothers are doing well. Which kinda sounds like a giant collective Yo' Mama joke. Which I'm totally fine with.
FIRST OFF - A few folks don't seem to have seen our last update. Feel free to pop back to read it now, but the tl;dr of it all is: We're delayed. Game's coming October, or November at the worst. We're working with a super experienced games publisher, so our adjusted timeline is now much firmer, like a Tempurpedic mattress, or the rebuke of an elder.
So, given that there isn't any news on that front, we figured we'd share a bunch of new artwork. Terry has been working 60-hour weeks finalizing the insanely complex imagery that goes into the 3D puzzle. Basically, Frankenstein's castle and its environs have been fully modelled in 3D. Then, through Terry magic, 2D textures are constructed to best simulate what it would "feel" like to be looking at this 3D castle from various angles, which are then applied to the facades. It sounds complicated, and is much more complicated than it sounds. (DO NOT get Terry started on "bleed". Trust me.)

updates.update_userinfo: New Designs! & A New Kickstarter from Our Partners on Mother of Frankenstein!
updates.update_content:
So why radically reimagine just ONE piece of Gothic literature when you can do them ALL?
  We're delighted to let you know about GRAY, from Arvind Ethan David, our partner on Mother of Frankenstein. Here's what I said about this when I first read it:

"Gray is the re-imagining of Oscar Wilde's classic tale I didn't know I needed, updating its themes for the modern era without losing any of the caustic wit or commentary that made the novel infamous in the first place..." -Me (Tommy Wallach) Co-Creator of Mother of Frankenstein & NYTimes Best-Selling Author

updates.update_userinfo: Just Don't Call Me Tom(my) DeLay
updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Happiest of Fridays to you all. I arrive today with some unfortunate news...with a silver lining. As has already been discussed in comments on previous updates, the realities of COVID manufacturing have caught up with us in a fairly significant way. While we've known we were delayed for a while now, we've been holding up on providing an update until we had a clearer idea of just how long it will be until we can deliver Mother of Frankenstein. We now have a clear-ish idea, so we're coming to you.

updates.update_userinfo: Three Volumes: One Game + A Free Puzzle Draft!
updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Happiest of Marches to you all.  Not too much to report at the moment, but wanted to let you know we are all alive and well and working away like the busiest of bees.  A few small updates:
1) Unfortunately, our biggest piece of news is not quite shareable yet, so you'll just have to keep holding out for it. However, I can tell you about one interesting related development: we are now planning to sell as This was a request from a lot of brick and mortar shops for whom the $120 MSRP was a little steep as the only available option. Instead, we expect the three volumes to cost around $40 a piece. To be clear, this will not affect Kickstarter in any way. All you lovely folks will be getting all three volumes at once and early, as promised. But it's still kinda cool.

Dearest Friends and Enemies,
We swore to ourselves we would be more open and communicative in this New Year. Thus, here we are again.
At the moment, we're finalizing the gameplay for Volume Two so that we can begin playtesting Volume One and Two together. We've come up with a pretty smashing finale for Volume Two that we're extremely excited about...but we're not about to give it away. A hint? Well let's just say you'll be doing things with a jigsaw puzzle you've never done before. (That sounds racy.)

Dearest Friends and Enemies,
This sure has been an exciting two weeks, hasn't it? Oof.
Well, whatever else is happening in the world, know that we here at Hatch are still making great strides and leaps and bounds as we continue to work to get Mother of Frankenstein to you as quickly as possible. We have some big news that we're not quiiiiiite ready to deliver just yet, so this update will be more about the cool work we're doing. Please do let us know in the comments what else you'd like to see/hear in these updates, and we'll strive to meet your demands!

campaign.story:
That’s exactly what this is!
Shut Up & Sit Down, the best board game site on the entire internet, has teamed up with the party game professionals at Big Potato Games. Together, we’ve created a brand-new edition of Don’t Get Got with 120 new missions and an aggressively orange colour scheme.
If you don’t own Don’t Get Got, that’s perfect. Included in this £20 box is everything you need to play.
If you DO own Don’t Get Got, that’s perfect too! Think of this box as a very generous expansion, doubling the amount of missions in the base game and letting you play with up to 20 players. Imagine that! It would be carnage.
Check out SU&SD’s glowing review!
Are you the kind of hotshot who doesn’t have 10 minutes to watch a video? Not a problem, here’s a quick gif-stuffed overview:
Don’t Get Got is a game of secret missions for 2-10 players, and it takes place while you go about your day. Perfect places to break out Don’t Get Got would be living with housemates, at work, on holiday, at parties, even at gaming conventions.
Each player receives a cute little wallet full of unique missions, and then you just get back to living your life, except you’re immediately going to start scheming like a mean scheme machine:
Hand out some random missions to each player
Each mission will tell you what you’ve got to try and trick the other players into doing...
Read and insert the missions into your wallet
Each time you succeed at this you get to (a) flip over the little mission in your wallet, which is super satisfying:
Nailed it!
and (b) reveal your mission to the player who just got got, which is even more satisfying:
Point and rejoice
But there’s a catch! If you ever get caught (which is as easy as another player asking if you’re trying to trick them), that mission is flipped over to the “FAILED IT” side for the rest of the game.
Failed it :'(
The first player to complete 3 missions wins!
Victory
The writers at Shut Up & Sit Down have had a great time creating new expansions for some of their favourite party games, like Monikers and The Metagame. When Big Potato asked if we wanted to design a brand-new box for Don’t Get Got, we leapt at the chance.
Included in this Shut Up & Sit Down Special Edition are 10 plastic wallets, 1 collectible sticker and 120 missions, all of which were painstakingly entered into a spreadsheet by team SU&SD.
In all seriousness, we worked super hard on this, and went through several rounds of refinement and feedback with the original game’s designers. The perfect Don’t Get Got mission makes you smile when you receive it, and represents an interesting, open-ended puzzle as to how exactly you’re going to pull it off. We aimed to deliver that with each and every mission.


But of course not! With enough pledges we will reveal not one, not five, but three stretchy goals that we’d like to offer all of our backers for absolutely free.
You took that poor target and smashed it into pieces!
As a reward, you’ve unlocked the ‘EPIC MISSIONS’ pack — 20 Kickstarter-exclusive missions that require so much forethought, even a criminal mastermind would wince at them.
Surprise extra stretchy goal unlocked! 
We messed up with the shipping, so here’s something to say sorry — all the cards from the original Don’t Get Got game. That’s 186 extra missions, carefully placed inside each and every copy of the Kickstarter special edition.
You want the rest? Well guess what, you can’t handle the rest!
Only joking, of course you can. Introducing the ‘GAME NIGHT’ pack — 20 Kickstarter-exclusive missions, all designed to be played while you’re playing another board game. How meta are we?
You’ve unlocked this year’s hottest fashion accessory!
Fresh from the catwalks of Milan, it’s the SU&SD x Big Potato pin badge. Whether you pin it to your bag, your ear or your fancy lapels, everyone will know you backed the hottest game around (and that you might be up to something sneaky).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It should be a relief to anyone who’s watched team SU&SD finger board game components into their mouths that they won’t be involved in manufacturing or fulfilment at all.

Instead, publishing and manufacturing will be handled by Big Potato Games, who have published over 50 games and distributed to countries all over the world. They have literally shipped out more games than you’ve had hot dinners. We're using Blackbox as our fulfilment service who are the complete bomb and we trust with all of our possessions.

Additionally, the copy of this Special Edition that you can see in the Kickstarter video is a near-final copy sent to us directly from the manufacturers, so all we need to do is tell them how many more copies to make. That’s why you can expect your copy of this edition as early as April 2021.


Thank you so much, everybody. 

Sincerely,

SU&SD and Big Potato

Around two weeks ago, we promised we’d be in touch with an update on shipping, to keep everyone’s minds at ease. Well, here it is: 

Everything is going exactly as planned… more or less!

Originally, we told everyone that the games would be arriving at the very end of May, but of course, they were never all going to arrive at the exact same time. A lot of you have already received your games (and we hope that your sneak skills are already maxed out), but there’s still some of you waiting. So, please refer to this handy guide from the factory:

updates.update_userinfo: AN UPDATE ON SHIPPING (AND EVERYTHING ELSE)
updates.update_content:
Hello

We’ll start with the “Everything Else”.

A few weeks ago, we asked you for your phone number. What we should’ve done is explain WHY we need it and WHAT we’ll be doing with it.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE: GETTING THE GAMES OUT OF CHINA
updates.update_content:
It’s been around a month-ish since our last update and you’ve probably got two big questions:
WHERE are the games?
WHEN am I getting them?
Well luckily, we’ve got answers for both. All the games are more or less finished — they’re just stuck in China, queuing to leave the factory. According to the latest news from our manufacturing partners, the games are scheduled to ship out of the factory on .

Hello,

It’s been a while since we’ve spoken, but rest assured, we haven’t been ignoring you.

Basically, there’s been a few production issues with the game that we’ve been trying to juggle. Before we announced the bad news to you, we wanted to see if there was anyway we could fix it — but sadly it looks like that’s not possible.

updates.update_userinfo: SOON TO BE SNEAKING INTO YOUR HOMES
updates.update_content:
Well — it sounded a lot better in our heads.
What we meant to say was: good news everyone! We managed to raise over $330,000, officially bringing our new creation to life!

Well would you look at that. You’ve gone and broken another one of our lovely, lovely targets. Looks like you’ve left us no choice. It’s time to reveal…
THE FINAL STRETCH-Y GOAL
Like a stoney-faced villain in Scooby-Doo, it’s time to pull the mask off our final stretch goal and end this madness once and for all. So, without further ado, here it is:
We keep setting up targets, you keep knocking them down. It’s a very nice feeling, so here’s a brand new Stretchy Goal to say thank you. It’s called the ‘GAME NIGHT’ pack!

campaign.story:
《器說⿓窯》是一本關於九件於1940至70年代於青山龍窯燒製的陶器的新書。「⻘⼭⿓窯」是香港現存唯一⼀條完整保留、曾⽤於燒製陶器的窯爐。興建於四⼗年代，「⿓窯」為三級歷史建築，是世界所餘無幾的同類型古陶窯，青山龍窯更見證了香港五十至八十年代工業興盛的黃金時代。
Objects of the Kiln is a book about the Castle Peak Dragon Kiln and the ceramic objects that were fired there. Built in the 1940s, this Grade 3 Historic Building is the last intact dragon kiln in Hong Kong and one of the few remaining structures of its kind left in the world. The kiln manufactured pottery used widely by Hong Kong people -- from clay pots to penny banks --  and is emblematic of Hong Kong’s post-war industrialisation from the 50s to the 80s.
這出版計劃由香港⿓窯關注組籌劃，關注組於2017年成立，致力研究及保存與龍窯相關的資料、向公眾推廣龍窯見證的香港歷史，並積極推動青山龍窯保育及活化。我們與政府爭取活化⿓窯之際，⼀直與時間競賽，訪問仍健在的燒窯師傅和陶藝家，把握機會，用書記載關於「青山龍窯」的人、事和香港記憶。沒有你的支持，我們不可能成功，立即支持我們的出版計劃，我們不能讓龍窯的故事失傳！
We, the Hong Kong Dragon Kiln Concern Group, have been conducting research on the kiln and advocating for its conservation and revitalization since 2017. As people who worked at the kiln are growing older, memories of the kiln are fading. Through this book, we hope to create a written and pictorial record of the kiln and its people. Support our project so that the stories of the kiln, and these valuable memories of our city, can be passed on. 
香港最後的一條龍窯
回到五、六⼗年代，香港造陶業興盛，由泥到陶，出產不少香港製造的陶器，青山（即屯門）更是當時香港造陶的「心臟地帶」。當中，「⻘⼭⿓窯」由商⼈司徒怒濤於四⼗年代興建，長20⽶，20度傾斜，依山而建，由於未能成功發展出⼝陶器業務， 轉⼿把⿓窯交給燒窯師傅梁森經營，梁森師傅伙拍⼀群燒窯⼯⼈，建立了「⼯合陶窯」象徵⼯⼈合作⽽成的陶窯，亦即今天的「⻘⼭⿓窯」。
Hong Kong's Last Dragon Kiln
By the 1950s, Castle Peak (now better known as Tuen Mun) was the heart of Hong Kong ceramic production with more than 10 ceramic factories. The Castle Peak Dragon Kiln, a 20-meter long tunnel-like structure, was built in the 40s by an overseas Chinese named Szeto Nao Tao (司徒怒濤). Initially a money-losing business, Szeto hired Leung Sum (梁森), a Shiwan kiln master who settled in Hong Kong in the 50s. Eventually, Leung and his workers took over the kiln and renamed it the "Workers' Pottery Kiln" (⼯合陶窯), firing functional ware of daily use until the 1980s. 
九段器物的記憶，九個香港的故事
...
「點煲㗎？」
 「放晒啲嘢落去咪得囉」

 不知怎樣，媽媽煲的湯，味道就是不一樣，特別是熬夜時喝到的一碗。疑團一直沒有解開，直到某天，媽媽到訪。

 「梗係唔得啦！用瓦煲慢慢煲先夠火候嘛。」

 曾經，每個媽媽都有一個瓦煲，就像這個當年响龍窯出產的。不過依家瓦煲越來越少見，期望有日龍窯活化，會有瓦煲應市，我們可以帶一個瓦煲給媽媽，品嚐媽媽的味道。
...
《器說⿓窯》訴說的不只是一條陶窯和一些陶器的故事，說的更是香港和香港人的故事。「⻘⼭⿓窯」燒製陶器品類繁多，曾出產不少家家⼾⼾必備的⽇⽤陶器。《器說⿓窯》精選九件產自青山龍窯、最具代表性的陶器，讓九件陶器，帶我們回味香港舊時光﹕
砂煲 — 家傳⼿作砂煲是家的獨特味道
五加⽪酒樽 — 武俠⽚外⼀樣能暢飲的五加⽪
窯磚 — 燒陶器的陶窯就⽤陶泥造
⽔渠 — 隱沒於都市之中的衛⽣基建
錢罌 — ⼩時候為了⼼頭好摔破破了的多少個錢罌
⾦塔 — 泛談殯葬、⺠間習俗、燒陶傳統
瓦⽚ — 樸素屋簷下製作精美陶瓷裝飾
匣鉢 — 燒窯的秘密武器
⽯灣公仔 — 精緻傳統藝術品
Nine Objects of the Kiln, Nine Stories of Hong Kong
...
"How do you make your soup, mom?" I ask. "Just throw all the ingredients in...." She says, all nonchalant. 
For some reason, Mom's soup always had a unique flavour. It was all a mystery until she came over one day, and saw MY version of HER soup. "Not like that!" she said. "You have to use the traditional claypot!" 
Once upon a time, every kitchen had a big clay soup pot. But they are hard to find, nowadays. Maybe if the dragon kiln fires again, I can get one, and make Mom's special soup again!
...
Objects of the Kiln tells the story of a kiln and its objects. It is also a tale about Hong Kong and its people. We will tell the story of 9 iconic objects in our book:
Clay pot – Handmade clay pot, homemade taste
Ng Ka Py (五加⽪) wine bottle – Not just for martial arts movie heroes!
Kiln brick – How a brick becomes a dragon kiln
Clay pipe – The hidden hygiene infrastructure of a city
Clay piggy bank – Saving up one coin at a time
Re-burial urn (金塔) - Funeral practices, folk rituals, and pottery traditions
Roof tile - Refined ceramic decorations made under one simple roof
Saggar (匣鉢) – The “secret weapon” of a successful firing
Guan Yu (關羽) – Shiwan figurines and an enchanting sculpture tradition

你所支付的籌集資金我們將用在什麼地方？
出版《器說龍窯》對香港龍窯關注組來說是個大膽的嘗試，因為我們不只希望透過這本書講述香港故事，更希望能藉這本書，將昔日的香港帶給身在世界各地的你。因此，我們堅持書本以繁體中文及英文雙語編寫，更在新書展示從未曝光的龍窯歷史圖片，為龍窯拍攝全新相集，並加入原創繪圖，務求多角度為你呈現龍窯的舊時光。從研究、撰文、編輯、攝影、繪圖、設計到出版《器說龍窯》是我們本地創作團隊的心血結晶。
我們有幸獲得衞奕信勳爵文物信託及信言設計大使的支持，因此得以為龍窯出版實體書，是次眾籌希望透過預售新書籌募資金，用以支付餘下的製作成本。預售情況亦能作為參考，助我們調整書本出版量，善用資源，減少浪費。
以下為出版資金佔比﹕
衞奕信勳爵文物信託 - 40%
信言設計大使 - 30%
書本眾籌預售 - 30%
合計 - 100%
如果籌得款項超過目標金額，我們會如何處理？
如籌得款項超過目標金額，額外籌得的款項將用於把書本免費送給學校及圖書館。若尚有剩餘資金，款項將只用作關注組舉辦活動的經費，以達成關注組四大目標（詳情見下文「關於我們」部分），這些活動包括﹕
公開展覽
公開及學校講座
出版活動相關刊物（例如陶器目錄、小冊子、傳單等）
訪問（短片攝影、剪輯、轉錄及翻譯）
歡迎瀏覽我們的 Facebook 專頁 www.facebook.com/hkdragonkiln，了解更多我們過往舉辦的活動。
What are you paying for?
Objects of the Kiln is an ambitious undertaking. While it is a distinctly Hong Kong story, we want to share it with the world, so the volume is written in both traditional Chinese and English. It will showcase never-before-seen archival images, brand new photography, and original illustration that bring the olden days of the kiln to life. All our collaborators -- including researcher, writer, editor, photographer, illustrator, designer and publisher -- are local creatives. 
We are grateful to have received funding from the Lord Wilson Heritage Trust and the Design Trust for a part of the book's funding. The purpose of this crowdfunding is to raise the remaining amount through a pre-sale of the book. Also, through your pledges, we will know how many copies to print,  thereby reducing waste. 
Our funding sources:
Lord Wilson Heritage Trust - 40%
Design Trust - 30%
Crowdfund Pre-sale - 30% 
Total - 100%
What if we pass our target?
If pledges exceed the target, we will use the funds to print extra copies that will be sent for free to schools and libraries. If there are still funds left over after that, they will be used strictly for activities that help our Concern Group achieve our mission (see more about us below). Those activities include:
public exhibitions
public and school talks
printed material (e.g. catalogue, pamphlets, leaflets) supporting these events
interviews (video recording, editing, transcribing and translating) 
For more information about our past activities, visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/hkdragonkiln.
香港龍窯關注組
香港龍窯關注組是非牟利民間組織，2017年成立，成員集藝術界、建築界、教育界等不同背景，愛好陶藝，推動龍窯保育及活化。至今所得、以至日後籌得的資金，我們將全數為完成下列目標所用。
關注組四大目標﹕
 活化香港龍窯，關注其保存及保育工作
保存龍窯相關資料
推動相關的公眾參與及教育
讓青山陶窯成為香港的一個「Living Museum」(活的博物館）
「青山龍窯」是屬於我們最後一條完整保留的龍窯，龍窯的未來岌岌可危，我們需要你們的支持，才能依靠記錄，守住我們珍重的香港歷史。
Facebook﹕@hkdragonkiln 
Instagram﹕@hongkongdragonkiln 
Website: hkdragonkiln.org 
Hong Kong Dragon Kiln Concern Group
The Hong Kong Dragon Kiln Concern Group is a non-profit civil society organization. We come from education, conservation, academic, arts and cultural sectors, as well as the ceramic industry, including potters, ceramic artists & workers, and art educators. All money raised has been and will always be used to fulfill our mission, which is to:
Conserve and revitalise the Castle Peak Dragon Kiln
Document and preserve related information
Promote public awareness, engagement and education
Establish a “living museum” at the site of the Castle Peak Dragon Kiln

《器說龍窯》是一本學術歷史書嗎？
《器說龍窯》並不是學術歷史書，這書集合了不少獨家⼈物專訪，更透過精細繪圖呈現龍窯的造陶生產線曾經如何運作，書中包括珍貴歷史資料圖片及未曝光龍窯相⽚集，全書以繁體中文及英文雙語編寫，圖文並茂、多⾓度為你重現青山⿓窯⾒證的⼀段香港歷史，一章一節說的，都是香港⼈容易忽略但不可或缺的昔⽇⽣活記憶。
Is this "Objects of the Kiln" an academic book?
No, “Objects of the Kiln” is all about Hong Kong’s ceramic-making history and our collective memories of our past. It is a book filled with photographs (both historical and new), colourful illustrations, and exclusive interviews. Written in Traditional Chinese and English, the book brings you to time-travel back to the golden age of the local ceramic-making industry.
我什麼時候能收到這本書？
書本將於2020年12月於香港出版，最快今年12月至明年1月，你便能讀到《器說龍窯》。
When will I get my copy of the book?
Our book will be published in December 2020. You will get your copy of book and start reading it by January 2021.
我能在 Kickstarter 以外的途徑買到這本書嗎？
我們主要透過Kickstarter預售書籍，書本發行細節待定。
Will the book be available outside of Kickstarter?
We are pre-selling most of our books through Kickstarter. Details of distribution will  be confirmed later.
如有其他查詢，歡迎發送電郵至 hkdragonkiln@gmail.com與我們聯絡。
If you have any other questions, email us at hkdragonkiln@gmail.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
我們正如火如荼地製作新書，新書計劃在2020年12月於香港出版。我們的製作進度理想，但仍希望為你解釋是次眾籌計劃牽涉的風險和挑戰。

1. 我們是否能完成這出版計劃？

我們的團隊早在去年夏天已著手製作新書，現已撰寫了新書中40%的文字及拍攝了80%的圖片。團隊成員包括撰文者、編輯、繪畫家、譯者、攝影師及設計師，一直合作順利。這次我們與香港獨立出版社 MCCM Creations 合作，目前書本製作進度理想。

另外，我們亦已獲得衞奕信勳爵文物信託及信言設計大使資助部分出版成本，加上你的支持，我們就更有信心完成出版，並將龍窯新書推廣給更多讀者。

2. 我們能妥善處理書本發行及運送事宜嗎？

我們將透過香港郵政寄出書本，雖然現時空郵服務受疫情影響，但我們希望亦相信相關服務將會在年底逐漸恢復，而我們的書本亦計劃在12月出版，因此我們希望能將我們的書順利寄出。若情況有更動，我們亦將於郵遞服務恢復後，儘快將書本寄出。有關送遞的最新安排，我們將於稍後公佈。

3. 我們會收集你的個人資料嗎？

如果項目成功獲得資助，我們將需要您向我們提供個人姓名和地址以方便我們發送書本。 因此，根據 Kickstarter 的《服務條款和隱私權政策》，我們將承擔安全處理此個人信息的責任。 我們只會使用這些信息來為你發送書本。


Our team is working feverishly on the new book. Hopefully, we are going to publish this book in December 2020 in Hong Kong, but we still want to let you know about some risks and challenges of our project.

1. Will we finish the project? 

40% of the text, 80% of photographs of our book have been completed. Our team of writers, editors, illustrators, translators, photographers, and designers have been working closely together on book production since last summer. We are working with MCCM Creations, one of the most creative independent book publishing houses in Hong Kong, to produce our book.

We have already received funding from Lord Wilson Heritage Trust and Design Trust. With your support for our project, we can ensure the completion of our project and our book reaching wider audiences.

2. Can we handle the logistics of distribution?

All books will be sent via Hong Kong Post. Due to the coronavirus, airmail is currently not available. With our December launch, we hope and believe service will have resumed by then. If not, we will dispatch them as soon as service resumes. We will keep you updated on book delivery.

3. Will you collect my personal information?

If the project is successfully funded, we will need to collect your name and address so we may send you the rewards. As such, and per Kickstarter's Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, we would bear the responsibility of handling this personal information safely. We will use this information solely for the purpose of providing you the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
YAY we got there!
We are heading to towards the stretch goal.
# If we reach this stretch goal, we will translate the book Planet Schooling and the Ebook - Soil Building with Worms for your home garden into Spanish. Sharing is caring. Sending love to as many families as we can.
This is the book that you have been waiting for! A book to support every conscious green parent, community educator and aspiring eco-kid!
I have been working with children and young adults in a permaculture-learning centre for the past 20 years. The centre is known as Ecocentro IPEC and is situated in Brazil. Living and learning at Ecocentro IPEC has given me a curious set of skills. I shared these skills through courses and projects with students from the USA, Haiti, Ethiopia, Guatemala, Ecuador, El Salvador and from all regions of Brazil and other countries of Latin America. I am happy to say that I have written several books that play an integral role in environmental education in Brazil.
Jumping forward! I returned to my homeland Australia and during these challenging times, buckled down and finished my book called Planet Schooling. I am super excited to share this with you. The book is packed with information and easy to follow activities. The best part is that children and young adults have tried and tested the activities contained within this book and have given them the thumbs up!
Know by supporting this book, you will also be supporting children from many different countries, see pledges for more information. If you are thinking, “I don’t have children”, we can help you connect with a community in need and donate a book on your behalf.
Your support is greatly appreciated. 
Planet Schooling Cover
What is in the book?
Planet Schooling is all about nature-based learning for adults and children alike. Learn alongside your child/ren, how to turn your backyard into a living and learning laboratory. Day to day routines in the home garden can become learning experiences, integrating mathematics, science, language arts and other subjects.
Planet schooling has over 250 pages with more than 120 real-life permaculture activities. With easy to follow step by step guides on how to re-design your space. Space could be your backyard, community garden or even your school. By re-designing your area, you can turn it into an effortless learning space where you can grow food and become more resilient.
How to Use Planet Schooling
This book demystifies environmental education while empowering you to take action for a greener future. You don’t have to be a teacher, you just need a sense of adventure. The activities can be easily adapted for K-12.
Activity Exemplar
Activity Exemplar
Planet schooling is the sister book to Escola Sustentável (Sustainable School) which was first published in Brazil in 2004. Sixteen years later, 10,000 copies have been distributed around Brazil.
A Escola Sustentável
How much work is left to do?
The book is currently being proofread will final edits being made. Then it will receive the last check, one more proofreading, design and print run. So it will be in your hands in October, just before the holiday season.
June 2020 - Kickstart campaign commences
Late July 2020 - Kickstart releases funds - Preparation for print
August 2020 - Send to the printer, Quality control
October - Ship book to backers
 Extra Benefits 
Apart from having a copy of the fantastic Planet Schooling book, you are invited to participate in various activities along with community gifting. As the pledge increases so do the benefits <3
 Ebook -  Soil Building with worms for your home garden 
Now is your chance to cultivate these little miracles of nature. In this 42 page e-book, we delve into seven different worm farm models which support earthworms and composting worms. Learn about the worm farm that suits your needs. It can be at home or on the farm, discover how to keep your worms happy in the worm farm and learn about troubleshooting.
Ebook - Soil building with worms
 The Mini Course - Soil Building With Worms 
Lucy is well known for her love of earthworms and who wouldn’t love a being that has 5 hearts and makes soil!
In this week-long online course, you will learn how to partner with nature’s little miracles to make all the natural fertiliser you need for your garden. With the help of worms, you can turn all your kitchen waste into worm casting and worm juice to fertilise and activate the soil in your home garden.
This Mini online course includes a live Q&A online gathering, interactive videos and the 42 page Ebook - Soil Building with Worms for your home garden.
Healthy soils mean healthy plants which also means healthy families.
Soil building with worms
 Full In-Depth 10 Week Course - Kickstart Your Home Garden 
This 10-week course is an interactive online course for anyone seeking to increase their knowledge in homesteading and Permaculture. It is packed with information, ideas and inspiration for you to learn how to design or re-design a home garden, backyard farm or community garden to be able to feed you and your family. Moving towards self-reliance and sustainability.
Delve into the science of soil, permaculture design, experiment with different garden techniques and learn how to manage your space.
During the course we will also support you in taking these experiences and turning them into learning experiences for your child/ren.
The course includes weekly Ebooks, exclusive videos, LIVE Q&A and access to Planet Schooling Members FB Group. 
During the weekly LIVE Q&A, you will have the opportunity to have your questions answered by the author and the Planet Schooling team. Week by week, we will connect by Zoom to discuss your Permaculture Action Plan (PAP) along with your educational plan.
By the end of the course you have the necessary skills and support to kickstart your backyard farm, home or community garden. 
9 Weekly Ebooks + Curriculum Connections Bonus Ebook
Supporting school communities in Brazil
We believe that sharing is caring!
As your pledge increases, we will donate the book ‘Escola Sustentável’ to public schools in Brazil on your behalf. We will register the name of the school, and your help will be gratefully acknowledged.
Update - 3 Vibrant oil paintings 
We have received 3 beautiful paintings made by the Brazilian artist, Juliana Ferraz. Each art piece is bright and colourful, approximately 30cm x 30cm, painted on quality canvas. 
Oil paintings by Brazilian Artist - Juliana Ferraz
Painting one is a positive twist on the Greek myth, Pandora's box. Pandora opens the box to allow the magic and mystery to escape during dark and dreary times.
Painting two celebrates the strength of women with the story of Nsomeka and Songi - The Great Mother of Bantu.
Painting three depicts the beautiful Chinese goddess of creation, Nu Kua. As she flicks soil through the air, the world is created. 
Go to the pledges, and they can be hanging on your wall soon.
Make Your Pledge 
Pledge Breakdown
Where is the money going?
Your pledges are bringing this book to life! Most of the funds will go to printing the book. Production and operational costs include paying the proofreaders and the graphic designer. The rest goes to Kickstarter fees and taxes. Know that your pledge is also helping communities in need.
Project Cost Breakdown

Stretch goals
#1: $20,000 - If we reach this goal we will unlock an extra 10 free downloadable activities and journal pages, to get you going in documenting the beautiful experience you are having with your child/ren.  
#2: $25,000 - If we reach this stretch goal, we will translate the book Planet Schooling and the Ebook - Soil Building with Worms for your home garden into Spanish. Sharing is caring. Sending love to as many families as we can. 
#3: $35,000 - If we reach this stretch goal,  500 printed books will be distributed to community groups in need in Central and South America. Sharing is caring. Sending love to all families everywhere.
And the future? Sharing the book to as many communities as possible.
